{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=April 2018}} {{Infobox scientist | name = [[Rai Bahadur]]
Daya Ram Sahni
[[Order of the Indian Empire|CIE]] | birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1879|12|16}} | image = | |birth_place = [[Bhera]], [[Punjab Province (British India)|Punjab]], [[British India]]
(now in [[Punjab Province, Pakistan]]) | spouse = | dead=dead | death_date = {{death date and age|df=yes|1939|03|07|1879|12|16}} | death_place = [[Jaipur]], [[Jaipur State]]
(now in [[Rajasthan]], [[India]])| known_for = excavations in [[Harappa]]| influences = [[John Marshall (archaeologist)|John Marshall]]| occupation = [[Sanskrit]] acholar, [[archaeologist]] }} [[Rai Bahadur]] '''Daya Ram Sahni''' [[Order of the Indian Empire|CIE]] (16 December 1879 – 7 March 1939) was an Indian archaeologist who supervised the excavation of the [[Indus Valley Civilization|Indus valley site]] at [[Harappa]] in 1921-22. A protege of [[John Marshall (archaeologist)|John Marshall]], in 1931, Sahni became the first Indian to be appointed Director-General of the [[Archaeological Survey of India]] (ASI), a position in which he served till 1935. == Early life and education == Daya Ram Sahni hailed from the city of [[Bhera]] in [[Shahpur district]], [[Punjab Province (British India)|Punjab]] where he was born on 16 December 1879. Sahni graduated in [[Sanskrit]] from the [[University of the Punjab|Punjab University]] with a gold medal. He also topped the M. A. examination from the Oriental College in 1903. As a result of this accomplishments, Sahni won the Sanskrit scholarship sponsored by the Archaeological Survey of India and recruited by the survey on completion of his education. == As archaeologist == In 1903, Sahni was posted to the Punjab and United Provinces circle where he worked under [[J. Ph. Vogel]]. Sahni was involved in the excavation of Kasia in 1905 and [[Rajgir]] in [[Bihar]] under John Marshall in January–February 1906. In September 1907, Sahni assisted Marshall in the excavation of a ''[[stupa]]'' at [[Rampurva]] in [[Champaran district]]. He also prepared a catalogue of archaeological ruins at [[Sarnath]]. Sahni worked as [[curator]] of [[Lucknow Museum]] from 1911 to 1912, when he was transferred to the archaeology department of [[Kashmir and Jammu (princely state)|Kashmir state]]. Sahni returned to Lahore in 1917 and was made incharge of United Provinces and Punjab. While working as Assistant Superintendent, Sahni excavated the Indus Valley site at Harappa, the first of the Indus Valley sites to be excavated. In 1925, Sahni was transferred to [[Delhi]] as Deputy Director-General of the Archaeological Survey of India and in July 1931, he succeeded Hargeaves as the Director-General of the ASI. Sahni was the first native Indian to be appointed to the post. == Honours == Sahni was awarded a "Rai Bahadur" medal in March 1920 by the Governor of Punjab at a durbar in [[Rawalpindi]]. Soon after his retirement from the ASI in 1935, Sahni was made a [[Order of the Indian Empire|Companion of the Order of the Indian Empire]]. archaeologist == References == * {{cite web|work=[[Current Science]]|url=http://www.ias.ac.in/jarch/currsci/8/280.pdf|title=Obituary}} {{s-start}} {{succession box|title=Director General of the [[Archaeological Survey of India]]|before=[[Harold Hargreaves]]|after=[[J. F. Blakiston]]|years=1931-1935}} {{s-end}} {{authority control}} [[Category:1879 births]] [[Category:1939 deaths]] [[Category:Companions of the Order of the Indian Empire]] [[Category:20th-century Indian archaeologists]] [[Category:Directors General of the Archaeological Survey of India]] [[Category:19th-century Indian archaeologists]] [[Category:Scientists from Punjab, India]] [[Category:People associated with the Indus Valley Civilisation]] [[Category:Indian institute directors]]

{{one source|date=October 2018}} {{Infobox serial killer | name = Diogo Alves | image = Diogo Alves - extraído de uma gravura da época (1840).png | image_size = 240px | caption = Diogo Alves in 1840 | alt = | birth_name = | alias = "The Aqueduct Murderer"
"Pancada” | birth_date = 1810 | birth_place = [[Samos, Lugo|Samos]], [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]], [[Spain]] | death_date = February 19, 1841 | death_place = [[Lisbon]], [[Portugal]] | cause = [[Execution]] | conviction = [[Murder]] | sentence = [[Death]] | victims = 4+ | beginyear = 1836 | endyear = 1840 | country = Portugal | states = [[Lisbon]] | apprehended = | imprisoned = }} '''Diogo Alves '''(1810 – February 19, 1841) was a Spanish-born Portuguese [[serial killer]]. Between 1836 and 1840, he killed several dozen people. The crimes he committed were all in the area of the [[Águas Livres Aqueduct]], thus earning the "Aqueduct Murderer". He was [[sentenced to death]] and hanged on February 19, 1841. The head of the killer was separated from the body and placed in a flask to preserve it for scientific purposes, where it is now a tourist attraction.[http://pereulki.com/2015/06/ubijtsa-s-akveduka-istoriya-diogo-alvesha-samogo-izvestnogo-prestupnika-portugalii/ The 'Aqueduct Murderer' Diogo Alves: Famous Portuguese Murderer] == Biography == Born in [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]] in a peasant family, Alves fell from the family horse while at a young age and hit his head, earning the nickname Pancada ("blow"). At the age of nineteen, his parents sent him to work in Lisbon. After changing several jobs and ceasing to write to his parents, he began to drink and gamble, meeting up with innkeeper Maria "Parreirinha" Gertrudes. It is believed that this connection instigated Alves to kill. He began to commit crimes, earning a second nickname "The Aqueduct Murderer". He robbed poor passers-by, and then dumped them from a height of 60 meters to simultaneously avoid identification and present the deaths as suicides, which he initially succeeded in. Murders on the aqueduct remained unproven, but the jury sentenced Alves and his gang for other crimes, in particular, murdering the four family members of a doctor. Maria's 11-year-old daughter, Maria de Conceicao, testified in court against the gang. Her mother was eventually sent to a lifelong exile in [[Africa]]n colonies. Alves became the penultimate (often mistakenly claimed to be the last) hanged criminal in Portugal. His actions at the time intrigued scientists from the then Medical-Surgical School of Lisbon. After his hanging, in an attempt to study his brain, Alves' head was cut off and studied. To this day it is still preserved in a glass vessel, where a [[solution]] of [[formaldehyde]] has perpetuated the image of calm man—quite contrary to what he really was. Scientists could never explain what led him to buy a false key for the Aqueducts, where he was hiding, and how many people he had robbed and killed.The severed head is currently in the [[anatomical]] theater of the University of Lisbon's Faculty of Medicine, following the formation of a [[phrenology]] cabinet made by José Lourenço da Luz Gomes, which allowed the preservation of Alves' skull, along with that of Matos Lobo (being one of the last subjects to whom the [[Capital punishment in Portugal|death penalty in Portugal]] was applied, something quite significant for the judicial history of Portugal) in the old medical-surgical school. The head of Diogo Alves was one of the most significant—and undoubtedly horrific—objects of the passage in ''One hundred pieces for the Museum of Medicine'', which took place in the [[National Museum of Ancient Art]] in 2005. == Bibliography == * Gideon High, Everything I did not want to know (translation and adaptation of Vladimiro Nunes), tinta da china, 2006. * Portugal — Historical, Corographic, Heraldic, Biographical, Bibliographic, Numismatic and Artistic Dictionary, Volume IV, pp. 599–600.. == References == {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Alves, Diogo}} [[Category:People executed by hanging]] [[Category:1810 births]] [[Category:Galician people (Spain)]] [[Category:Portuguese serial killers]] [[Category:1841 deaths]] [[Category:Male serial killers]] [[Category:Executed serial killers]]

{{Infobox Officeholder |name = Edwin S. Broussard |image = Senator Edwin Broussard seated.jpg |jr/sr = United States Senator |state = [[Louisiana]] |term_start = March 4, 1921 |term_end = March 4, 1933 |predecessor = [[Edward James Gay (1878–1952)|Edward J. Gay]] |successor = [[John H. Overton]] |birth_date = {{birth date|1874|12|4}} |birth_place = [[Loreauville, Louisiana]], U.S. |death_date = {{death date and age|1934|11|19|1874|12|4}} |death_place = [[New Iberia, Louisiana]], U.S. |resting_place=St. Peter's Cemetery,
New Iberia, Louisiana, U.S. |party = [[Progressive Party (United States, 1912)|Progressive]]
[[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] |spouse ={{marriage|Marie Patout
|1904|1934|end=his death}} |children =6 |alma_mater =[[Tulane University Law School]] |relatives = [[Robert F. Broussard]] (brother) }} '''Edwin Sidney Broussard''' (December 4, 1874 – November 19, 1934), was a [[United States Senate|United States senator]] from [[Louisiana]], with serve for two terms from March 5, 1921, to March 3, 1933. ==Early life== Broussard was born in the village of [[Loreauville, Louisiana]], and attended [[Public school (government funded)|public schools]]. He graduated in 1896 from the [[Louisiana State University]] in [[Baton Rouge]]. He taught for two years thereafter in the public schools of Iberia and [[St. Martin Parish|St. Martin]] parishes."Edwin Sidney Broussard", ''A Dictionary of Louisiana Biography'', Vol. 1 (1988), [[Louisiana Historical Association]] publication, pp. 113–14. ==Career== At the outbreak of the [[Spanish–American War]], Broussard volunteered for the [[United States Army]]. A [[Captain (United States)|captain]] in [[Cuba]], in 1898 and 1899, he accompanied the [[Taft Commission]] to the [[Philippine Islands]] in 1899 and served as an assistant secretary. He returned to the United States in 1900 and graduated the next year from the [[Tulane University Law School]] in [[New Orleans]]. In 1901, he was admitted in 1901 to the [[bar (law)|bar]] and established his practice in [[New Iberia, Louisiana|New Iberia]], the Iberia Parish [[County seat|seat of government]]. Broussard was [[prosecuting attorney]] for the Louisiana 19th Judicial District from 1903 to 1908. Between 1914 and 1916, he affiliated with the [[Progressive Party (United States, 1912)|Progressive Party]], formed by [[Theodore Roosevelt]], who had gained national attention for organizing the [[Rough Riders]] in the Spanish–American War. Broussard opposed the New Orleans Democratic party machine, known as the [[Regular Democratic Organization|Old Regulars]]. Broussard ran unsuccessfully in 1916 for [[Lieutenant Governor of Louisiana|lieutenant governor]] on an intra-party Progressive [[Ticket (politics)|ticket]] with [[governor of Louisiana|gubernatorial]] candidate [[John M. Parker]], another Roosevelt loyalist. Broussard lost to Fernand Mouton. Parker was defeated that year too by [[Ruffin G. Pleasant]] of [[Shreveport, Louisiana|Shreveport]], but rebounded to victory for governor in 1920 as a [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrat]]. In 1920, Broussard was elected as a Democrat to fill the seat vacated two years earlier by his late brother, U. S. Senator [[Robert F. Broussard]]. He defeated [[Conservative (politics)|conservative]] former Governor [[Jared Y. Sanders, Sr.]] Broussard was a strong advocate of the sugar [[tariff]] and federal [[flood control]] projects important to his state. He was reelected in 1926 by defeating Sanders once again and with the then support of [[Louisiana Public Service Commission]]er and later Governor [[Huey Pierce Long, Jr.]] The [[Ku Klux Klan]] rallied against Broussard because of his [[Roman Catholicism]] in support of Sanders. He was denied renomination in the 1932 Democratic [[primary election]] by Huey Long's choice for the position, [[John H. Overton|John Holmes Overton]] of [[Alexandria, Louisiana|Alexandria]] in [[Rapides Parish, Louisiana|Rapides Parish]]. Long had backed Broussard in 1926 and Broussard had supported Long for governor in 1928 but not for senator in 1930. Broussard had called upon Long as senator-elect to resign as governor and turn over the office to Lieutenant Governor [[Paul N. Cyr]], a Long former ally turned opponent. Long remained senator-elect for more than a year, however, and did not work well with Broussard as his fellow senator. Broussard even praised his own former opponent, Jared Y. Sanders, whom Long had helped Broussard to defeat. Long by then considered Broussard "a conservative" in the mold of Sanders and favored the more moderate Overton as Broussard's Senate replacement. In his [[autobiography]], ''[[Every Man a King]]'', Long took credit for Broussard's re-election to his second Senate term: "I supported him, and he hasn't a friend in the state who would say that he could have been elected to the Senate in 1926 if it had not been for me. ... Are his attacks on me a return of such favors? Is that the way some people have of repaying others for help that they get from them? ... Now Senator Broussard attacks me, without cause, and praises J. Y. Sanders. ..."[[Huey Pierce Long, Jr.]], ''Every Man a King: The Autobiography of Huey P. Long'' ([[New Orleans]]: National Book Club, Inc., 1933), pp. 256-257. After his defeat, Broussard resumed his law practice and tended to [[banking]] and financial affairs in New Iberia, where he died in 1934 and is interred there at St. Peter's Cemetery. ==Personal life== On June 5, 1904, Broussard married Marie Clair Patout (1878{{ndash}}1945), the daughter of Felix Patout (1834{{ndash}}1918){{cite web|url=http://findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=Patout&GSfn=Claire&GSbyrel=all&GSdyrel=all&GSob=n&GRid=28935612&df=all&|title=Felix Patout|publisher=Findagrave.com|accessdate=January 21, 2017}} and [[French people|French]] woman Claire Tate (1854{{ndash}}1913).{{cite web|url=http://findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=Patout&GSfn=Claire&GSbyrel=all&GSdyrel=all&GSob=n&GRid=28935612&df=all&|title=Claire Tate Patout|publisher=Findagrave.com|accessdate=January 21, 2017}} The couple had six children, including Mary Louise Broussard Brown (1910–2010); John Dorville Broussard (1913–1989); Edwin S. Broussard, II; George P. Broussard (1916–1977), a [[veterinary medicine]] researcher; and Eugene D. Broussard (1917–2008).{{cite web|url=http://findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=Broussard&GSfn=Marie&GSbyrel=all&GSdyrel=all&GSst=20&GScnty=1131&GScntry=4&GSob=n&GRid=18035641&df=all&|title=Marie Clair Patout Broussard|publisher=Findagrave.com|accessdate=January 21, 2017}} {{Commons category}} {{Portalbar|Louisiana|Politics|Law|Education|Business and Economics|United States Army|Christianity}} ==References== {{reflist}} * {{CongBio|B000895}} Retrieved on May 18, 2009 {{s-start}} {{s-par|us-sen}} {{U.S. Senator box | state=Louisiana | class=3 | before=[[Edward James Gay (1816–1889)|Edward James Gay]] | after=[[John H. Overton]] | alongside=[[Joseph E. Ransdell]], [[Huey Pierce Long, Jr.]] | years=1921–1933}} {{s-end}} {{USSenLA}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Broussard, Edwin S.}} [[Category:1874 births]] [[Category:1934 deaths]] [[Category:United States Army soldiers]] [[Category:American military personnel of the Spanish–American War]] [[Category:United States Senators from Louisiana]] [[Category:People from New Iberia, Louisiana]] [[Category:Louisiana State University alumni]] [[Category:Louisiana lawyers]] [[Category:Tulane University Law School alumni]] [[Category:Educators from Louisiana]] [[Category:American bankers]] [[Category:Cajun people]] [[Category:Democratic Party United States Senators]] [[Category:Louisiana Democrats]] [[Category:Louisiana Progressives (1912)]] [[Category:Huey Long]] [[Category:Burials in Louisiana]] [[Category:People from Iberia Parish, Louisiana]]

<!-- Deleted image removed: [[File:ElieYossefprotest.JPG|right|thumb|200px|Elie Yossef with Mehi (Magshimey Herut Yisrael) activists at a political demonstration in Jerusalem]] --> '''Elie Yossef''' (also Eli Joseph, {{lang-he|אֵלִי יוֹסֵף}}) is a London-born [[Israelis|Israeli]] educator and political activist.
Eli Yossef grew up in [[London]] and attended the [[Hasmonean High School]] where he established [[Betar]] [[England]] in 1973. {{Citation needed|date=June 2008}} In 1975, Yossef emigrated to [[Israel]] and served in the [[Golani Brigade|Golani]] and [[Paratroopers]] brigades of the [[Israel Defense Forces]]. After completing his military service, Yossef studied at [[Machon Meir]] and [[Hebrew University]]. In 1988, Yossef founded a [[Youth Aliyah]] (Aliyat haNoar) high school for new immigrants from France. {{Citation needed|date=June 2008}}In 1997, he organized a military preparatory program for [[Jewish]] students from abroad interested in volunteering in Israel's army.<ref>[http://www.ajerusalemhome.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=42&Itemid=57 Eli Joseph Biography - Eli Joseph's Jerusalem Real Estate Homepage and Buyer's Guide - A Jerusalem Home.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
One of his major causes is freeing [[Jonathan Pollard]].<ref>[http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/68367 Special Pollard Session Next Week - Inside Israel - Israel News - Arutz Sheva<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> In January 2000, Yossef conducted a hunger strike on Pollard's behalf outside of Israel's Parliament. He argued that anyone who passes classified information to the State of Israel regarding enemy intentions to harm Israel is morally innocent even if technically guilty by American law.<ref>[http://www.jafi.org.il/agenda/english/index4.asp#4 Agenda-English<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> In 2002 Yossef traveled to numerous Israeli high-schools and spoke of Pollard's plight as a moral national issue. Yossef's efforts to free Pollard has led him to collaborate with former Prisoners of Zion [[Natan Sharansky]] and Rabbi [[Yosef Mendelevitch]] over the years, highlighting the similarities between their situations in the Soviet Union and Pollard's in the United States.<ref>[http://www.estherpollard.org/2003/112403.htm Eli Joseph to Speak on Pollard at Manhigut Yehudit Conference<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.jonathanpollard.org/2004/041304.htm Mendelovitch and Joseph Arrested Last Night; Another Pollard Demo Today<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Yossef has urged the Israeli government to establish what happened to [[Raoul Wallenberg]], a [[Sweden|Swedish]] diplomat who saved countless Jews from the [[Holocaust]] during [[World War II]] but was arrested following the war by [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] agents and disappeared.<ref>[http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/71805 For Pollard: Classes, Prayers, Visits and Hunger Strike - Jewish World - Israel News - Arutz Sheva<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Following the violent confrontation at [[Amona, Mateh Binyamin|Amona]] between the [[Israeli police]] and [[settler]] teenagers in early 2006, Yossef led [[Magshimey Herut|Mehi]] activists on a three-week hunger strike vigil protesting violence between Jews. The activists displayed banners and handed out fliers calling on the Israeli government and settler leadership to seek out ways to avoid future bloodshed.<ref>[http://www.israelnationalnews.com/news.php3?id=98602 on A7radio: New Hunger Strike, Gush Katif Refugee Speaks - On A7 Radio - Israel News - Arutz Sheva<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Yossef has called on the government of Israel to cut diplomatic ties to [[Russia]] due to Russia's involvement in [[Iran]]'s nuclear development program.<ref name="israelnationalnews.com">[http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/121699 Russia Moves in Support of Syria, Iran, Hamas-Led PA - Defense/Middle East - Israel News - Arutz Sheva<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/121706 Jewish Cowardliness Exposed - On A7 Radio - Israel News - Arutz Sheva<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Yossef told [[Israel National Radio]]'s [[Yishai Fleisher]] that "the Jewish People must find the moral courage to stand up to super-powers in such situations."<ref name="israelnationalnews.com"/>
Yossef actively opposed the [[Camp David Accords]] with [[Egypt]] and Israel's subsequent withdrawal from the [[Sinai Peninsula]]). Yossef has referred to himself as a "Humanitarian Zionist".
Yossef now works as a [[real estate agent]]. In August 2005 he founded the Eli Joseph Jerusalem Real Estate company.<ref>[http://www.ajerusalemhome.com/index.php?option=com_frontpage&Itemid=1 Home - Eli Joseph's Jerusalem Real Estate Homepage and Buyer's Guide - A Jerusalem Home.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
==See also== * [[Magshimey Herut]] * [[Revisionist Zionism]] * [[Zionism]]

{{Infobox pretender | name = George Obrenovic | image = Prince George Obrenovic.jpg | birth_date = {{Birth-date|March 1890}} | birth_place = [[Belgrade]], [[Kingdom of Serbia]] | death_date = {{Death-date and age|9 October 1925|March 1890}} | death_place = [[Hungary]] | regnal = | title = Prince George Obrenović | throne = [[Serbia]] | pretend from = 11 June 1903 | year = 1903¹ | king = [[Alexander I of Serbia]] | relationship = Half brother | house = | father = [[Milan I of Serbia]] | mother = Artemisia Christich | spouse = | children = | predecessor = | successor = | footnotes = ¹ year House of Obrenović deposed }} '''Milan George Obrenovic''' (1889<ref>Allström, Carl Magnus (1904). Dictionary of royal lineage of Europe and other countries. Volume 2.</ref>/March 1890<ref>{{Citation | title = George Obrenovitch, The Boy Pretender to the shaky throne of Servia. | newspaper = [[Detroit Free Press]] | pages = D5 | date = 25 February 1906 }}</ref> – 9 October 1925)<ref name=last/> born '''Obren Christich''' was the [[Legitimacy (family law)|natural]] son of King [[Milan I of Serbia]] and his [[Greeks|Greek]] mistress Artemisia Hristić (née Joanides). After the [[regicide]] of his half brother King [[Alexander I of Serbia|Alexander]] in 1903 George became a claimant to the Serbian throne in opposition to the new king, [[Peter I Karadordevic]] before ending his life in obscurity.
==Birth and family background== Although commonly known as George Obrenović he was born in [[Belgrade]]<ref name=MDF1908/> as Obren Hristić. Acknowledged by King Milan as his son, he was given the name Obren at birth to underline his kinship to the ruling [[House of Obrenović]].<ref>{{Citation | title = Ex-King Milan | volume = LV | issue = 6 | newspaper = [[The Evening Post (New Zealand)|The Evening Post]] | pages = 5 | date = 8 January 1898 }}</ref> The husband of George’s mother was Milan Hristić, the king’s private secretary and son of the Serbian statesman [[Filip Hristić]].
The relationship between the parents of George and the fact his mother was living in the Royal Palace, caused a great scandal and resulted in Queen [[Natalie of Serbia|Natalie]] fleeing Belgrade with her son Crown Prince [[Alexander I of Serbia|Alexander]] for [[Wiesbaden]] in the German Empire. His mother’s husband was subsequently removed from his position as private secretary and sent abroad as Serbian Minister to [[Berlin]] on condition his wife stays in Belgrade. This appointment fell through however after the Berlin court made it clear he was unwelcome so he was instead sent to Rome.<ref>{{Citation | title = Servia is a hotbed of wicked plots | newspaper = The Dupuyer Acantha | pages = 18 | date = 21 September 1899 }}</ref> Although King Milan had given a written promise of marriage to Artemisia his attempts to divorce Queen Natalie were opposed by Michael, the [[Metropolitan of Belgrade]].<ref>{{Citation | title = Milan's new intrigue | newspaper = [[The Evening Telegram]] | pages = 3 | date = 10 January 1898 }}</ref>
Eventually both of George’s parents secured divorces from their respective spouses. Five months after his divorce on 6 March 1889 King Milan abdicated from the Serbian throne angering George’s mother. After eventually growing tired of ex-King Milan’s demands for money from her, Artemisa took George to live in [[Constantinople]] where her father lived and had acquired substantial wealth first as a landscape gardener and architect to the [[Ottoman sultan]] and later in Banking.<ref name=MDF1908>{{Citation | title = Marquise de Fontenoy | newspaper = [[Chicago Daily Tribune]] | pages = 10 | date = 18 April 1908 }}</ref> Ex-King Milan then broke off his promise of marriage and turned instead to the Serbian government for financial assistance<ref name=MDF1908/> and was eventually even reconciled with his ex-wife Queen Natalie on 8 March 1893.<ref>{{Cite book | title = [[Almanach de Gotha]] | publisher = [[Justus Perthes]] | edition =159th | year = 1922 | pages = 100}}</ref>
==Serbian pretender==
With the breakdown of the relationship of his parents George was raised in a privileged environment by his mother in Constantinople.<ref name=MDF1908/> Following the death in 1901 of his father in exile in [[Vienna]], George’s life changed. Some of his late father’s friends who were appalled by his half brother King Alexander’s treatment of King Milan took an interest in him as a possible candidate for the Serbian throne. One friend, the Hungarian count Eugene Zichy, assumed the role of his guardian. Count Eugene generally treated him as his own son and attempted to get the agreement of Emperor [[Franz Joseph I of Austria|Franz Joseph I]] to enrol George in the [[Theresian Military Academy]].<ref name=MDF1908/> However, as his pretensions to the Serbian throne were not viewed favourably in Vienna the emperor refused to allow his enrolment.<ref name=MDF1903>{{Citation | title = Letter of Marquise de Fontenoy | newspaper = [[Chicago Daily Tribune]] | pages = 6 | date = 20 October 1903 }}</ref>
Although the natural son of King Milan and even though his half brother and his consort [[Draga Mašin|Queen Draga]] were without an heir George was not seen by his half brother as a possible successor to the throne. Instead the queens brother Nikodije Lunjevica and [[Prince Mirko of Montenegro]], who was married to [[Natalija Konstantinović]] (granddaughter of [[Princess Anka Obrenović]]) were talked of as being named the heir.
After the regicide of his half brother King Alexander and his consort Queen Draga in 1903 the throne of Serbia was offered to Prince [[Peter I of Serbia|Peter Karageorgevich]] whose family had a decades long feud with the Obrenović’s over the throne. As the sole male line descendant of the Obrenović’s, George’s guardian Count Eugene claimed that his father King Milan had legally adopted him and as such this was enough to legitimise him, and his claims to the throne and make him the heir to his father and half brother.<ref name=MDF1903/> George had support within Serbia in the aftermath of the regicide with his supporters posting proclamations in Belgrade and fighting with supporters of the newly elected king, Peter Karageorgevich.<ref>{{Citation | title = Peter Accepts | newspaper = The Chenango Semi-Weekly Telegraph | pages = 4 | date = 17 June 1903 }}</ref> Although there were reports that George and his mother were to cross over into Serbia nothing came of this<ref>{{Citation | title = The Porte Notified | newspaper = The Deseret News | pages = 1 | date = 16 June 1903 }}</ref> and the Ottoman sultan advised his mother that he should be kept off the streets over fears that he would be assassinated.<ref>{{Citation | title = Fears attempt to kill young Milan | newspaper = Easton Free Press | pages = 1 | date = 17 June 1903 }}</ref>
In 1906, three years after the death of his half brother and the accession of King Peter Karageorgevich, George made an unsuccessful attempt to gain the throne of Serbia.<ref name=adg>{{Cite book | title = [[Almanach de Gotha]] | publisher = Almanach de Gotha | volume = 1 |edition=186th | year = 2003 | pages = 349}}</ref> In June while studying in [[Klausenburg]], [[Kingdom of Hungary|Hungary]] a dispute in a coffee shop led to a [[duel]] with swords being fought between George and a university student. Although he survived the duel he came off worse sustaining injuries to his head, shoulder and breast.<ref>{{Citation | title = King's son is wounded in duel with student |page=4 | newspaper = [[The Washington Times]] | date = 19 June 1906 }}</ref> He suffered a further blow at the end of that year when his guardian Count Eugene Zichy died on Boxing Day<ref>{{Citation | title = Count Eugene Zichy | newspaper = [[New York Times]] | date = 27 December 1906 }}</ref> leaving George little in his will having used his own money to support his pretensions, as King Milan had left nothing to his son.<ref name=MDF1908/> All was not lost however as he still had a large inheritance to look forward to from his grandfather in Constantinople.
==Fall into obscurity==
Back in the Ottoman capital in February 1907 George survived an assassination attempt when a man wielding a dagger attempted to stab him in his chest, however he escaped with just a scratch after the dagger hit a thick pocket book he was carrying.<ref>{{Citation | title = Tries to kill Milan's son | newspaper = [[New York Times]] | date = 7 February 1907 }}</ref> Five months later in July 1907 a bomb went off outside the US Embassy in Constantinople. As George lived in a house adjourning the embassy word spread that it was an assassination attempt by agents of King Peter Karageorgevich. This explanation for the bombing was met with some scepticism and viewed by some as an attempt to use the explosion to keep George in the public eye.<ref>{{Citation | title = Bomb not for Leishman | newspaper = [[The Baltimore Sun]] | pages = 7 | date = 17 July 1908 }}</ref> The following month it was reported that he had attempted to take his own life after the Ottoman authorities had refused to allow him to assume the surname Obrenović.<ref>{{Citation | title = Cable News | volume = XXIX | issue = 7268 | newspaper = [[Ashburton Guardian]] | pages = 2 | date = 8 January 1898 }}</ref> There may however have been other issues on his mind as an investigation into the bombing concluded that George had set it up himself to make it look like an attempt on his life. As a result, he was expelled from Turkey by the Sultan. The discovery also cost George his inheritance from his grandfather who was furious at his grandsons actions wrote him out of his will. His grandfather died later that year before any chance for reconciliation could ever take place.<ref name=MDF1908/>
Now banished from Turkey George made his way to Paris before heading to [[Austria-Hungary]] where he received some support from his late father’s friends<ref name=MDF1908/> who saw the potential that he may oneday ascend the Serbian throne.<ref name=spencer>{{Citation |last= Spencer |first=James | title = Traded claim to throne to lead life of dishonour | newspaper = [[The Atlanta Constitution]] | pages = B1 | date = 18 April 1909 }}</ref> To help boost his finances failed attempts were also made to secure a rich wife from Austria-Hungary or America for him. When the support came to an end he largely disappeared from view travelling around Europe and falling into debt.<ref name=spencer/> Eventually he fell into comparative poverty and tried his hand at a number of different jobs to survive.<ref name=miami>{{Citation | title = Son of King Milan is waiter on dining car | newspaper = [[The Miami News]] | pages = 7 | date = 19 August 1916 }}</ref> After his attempt to work in the Austro-Hungarian state ministries failed due his lack of qualifications he worked at various jobs such as a stable boy and professional jockey<ref name=last>{{Citation | title = Last Obronovitch Dies | newspaper = [[New York Times]] | date = 11 October 1925 }}</ref> before trying his hand at singing in Café’s<ref>{{Citation | title = King's son a cafe singer | newspaper = [[New York Times]] | date = 28 January 1909 }}</ref> and on stage, until he was forced to abandon that career by the police due to the fact he had been billing himself as a prince.<ref name=miami/> He then went on to work as a waiter, and a porter in sleeping cars on the [[Orient Express]].<ref name=last/> His name reappeared in connection to his old pretensions during the [[World War I]] when it was falsely reported in January 1916 that he had been proclaimed [[King of Serbia]] by the Germans and Austro-Hungarians.<ref>{{Citation | title = Proclaim new Serb King?; Italian Story That Teutons Have Chosen Natural Son of Milan | newspaper = [[New York Times]] | date = 13 January 1916 }}</ref>
George later went on to become a writer however the only book he ever wrote, which was about the life of his father King Milan, was suppressed by the Serbian government. George Obrenović died penniless in a Hungarian [[poorhouse]] on 9 October 1925.<ref name=last/>
==Possible descendants==
According to a 2003 article by the Serbian media company [[Novosti AD]], George had a son called Stefan who served as a cavalry captain in the [[French Army]]. Stefan in turn had a son named Panta (Panka) Obrenović (also known as Mark Eme) who served as chairman of the "Fund Obrenović" until his death in [[Paris]] in early 2002.<ref>{{cite news |title=Nasleđe umesto krune |author=Milorad BOŠNJAK |url=http://www.novosti.rs/vesti/naslovna/aktuelno.69.html:143406-Nasle273e-umesto-krune |newspaper=[[Novosti AD]] |date=11 January 2003 |accessdate=12 September 2011}}</ref>

'''Gonzalo Güell y Morales de los Ríos''' (16 February 1895 in [[Havana]], [[Cuba]] – 2 September 1985 in Coral Gables, Miami-Dade County, Florida USA) was a Cuban lawyer and a career diplomat (1919–1959).
Guell was [[Foreign relations of Cuba|Foreign Minister]] of [[Cuba]] from 1956 to 1959 and [[Prime Minister of Cuba]] from March 12, 1958 to January 1, 1959. He also served as the Cuban [[Ambassador]] to [[Mexico]], [[Colombia]], [[Brazil]], [[Norway]] and the [[United Nations]].
He was one of the 40 persons that flew with [[Fulgencio Batista]] to the [[Dominican Republic]] on New Year's Eve 1959 when [[Fidel Castro]] took over Cuba.
He was married 3 times. Two of his wives were Francisca Pubill and Juana Inigo. He had no children.

{{About|the comedy duo|the radio program of the same name|Hamish & Andy (radio show)}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2010}} {{Infobox comedian | name = Hamish & Andy | image = Hamish & Andy - 2009 ARIA Awards.jpg | imagesize = 220px | caption = [[Andy Lee (comedian)|Andy Lee]] (left) and [[Hamish Blake]] (right) at the [[ARIA Music Awards of 2009]] | pseudonym = | birth_date = | birth_place = | medium = [[Television]], [[radio]] | nationality = Australian | active = 2003–present | genre = [[Talk radio|Talk Radio]] | subject = | influences = | influenced = | domesticpartner = | notable_work = ''[[Hamish & Andy (radio show)|The Hamish & Andy Show]]'', ''[[Rove (TV series)|Rove]]'', ''[[Hamish & Andy's Gap Year]]'' | signature = | website = {{URL|http://www.hamishandandy.com/}} | footnotes = }} '''Hamish & Andy''' are an Australian [[comedy duo]] formed in 2003 by [[Hamish Blake]] and [[Andy Lee (comedian)|Andy Lee]]. They are most known for their successful drive-time radio show, ''[[Hamish & Andy (radio show)|The Hamish & Andy Show]]'' (and its various follow-ups), and for their work on television as correspondents on ''[[Rove (TV series)|Rove]]'' and their [[Nine Network]] series ''[[Hamish & Andy's Gap Year]]''.{{Cite news |title = Hamish and Andy confirm Nine deal |work = The Spy Report |publisher = Media Spy |date = 25 February 2010 |url = http://www.mediaspy.org/report/2011/02/25/hamish-and-andy-confirm-nine-deal/ |accessdate = 25 February 2010 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20110228105647/http://www.mediaspy.org/report/2011/02/25/hamish-and-andy-confirm-nine-deal/ |archivedate = 28 February 2011 |df = dmy-all }} In addition, they have made numerous appearances hosting events, and competing on [[game shows]] and in celebrity sporting events. ==Background== The two met while Lee was studying [[Commerce]] and Blake was studying [[Commerce]]/[[Science]] at the [[University of Melbourne]], and entered comedy competitions. ==Radio career== Hamish & Andy have presented radio programmes for [[Fox FM (Melbourne)|Fox FM]] in a variety of formats since 2003. {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" style="background: #D3D3D3" width="250px" | Program Title ! scope="col" style="background: #D3D3D3" width="125px" | Year ! scope="col" style="background: #D3D3D3" width="175px" | Timeslot ! scope="col" style="background: #D3D3D3" width="100px" | Duration ! scope="col" style="background: #D3D3D3" | Station |- | align="center" | ''The Almost Tuesday Show''https://www.radioinfo.com.au/news/melbourne%E2%80%99s-hamish-andy-hit-brisbane-airwaves|Radio Info, Jun 5 2006 | 2003 | 10 p.m. – midnight Mondays | 2 hours | [[Fox FM (Melbourne)|Fox FM]] |- | align="center" | ''The Almost Midday Show'' | 2004–2005 | 10 a.m. – noon Saturdays | 2 hours | 2004: [[Fox FM (Melbourne)|Fox FM]]
2005: [[Today Network]] |- | rowspan="3" align="center" | ''[[Hamish & Andy (radio show)|The Hamish & Andy Show]]'' | 2006–2010 | 4–6 p.m. weekdays | 2 hours | January 2006: [[Fox FM (Melbourne)|Fox FM]]
June 2006: [[Today Network]] and regionalshttps://www.radioinfo.com.au/news/labrat-b105-more-hamish-andy-and-kate-mac-2day|RadioInfo, 10 December 2006 |- | 2011–2012 | 4–6 p.m. Fridays | 2 hours | rowspan="4"| [[Today Network]] and regionals |- | rowspan="2"| January–July 2013 | 4–6 p.m. Mondays | 2 hours |- | align="center" | ''[[Hamish & Andy (radio show)#Hamish & Andy's Business Brunch|Hamish & Andy's Business Brunch]]'' | 9–10 a.m. Tuesday–Friday10–11 a.m. on [[2DayFM]] in Sydney due to ''[[The Kyle & Jackie O Show]]'' running until 9:30 a.m. | 1 hour |- | align="center" | ''[[Hamish & Andy (radio show)#Hamish & Andy's Happy Hour|Hamish & Andy's Happy Hour]]'' | July 2013 – November 2014 | 3–4 p.m. Weekdays | 1 hour |- | align="center" | ''[[Hamish & Andy (radio show)|The Hamish & Andy Show]]'' | 6 July 2015 – 1 December 2017 | 4–6 p.m. Weekdays | 2 hours | [[Hit Network]] and regionals |} The duo began [[Radio personality|presenting radio]] on the [[Student Youth Network]], in the Friday afternoon drivetime slot. In 2003, soon after Hamish began writing for the [[Fox FM (Melbourne)|Fox FM]] breakfast show ([[The Matt & Jo Show]]), the pair began hosting a Monday night late-night radio program called ''Almost Tuesday'' on the same station. The duo then hosted the Fox FM program, ''Almost Midday'' on Saturday mornings, which was so successful it was syndicated nationally across the [[Today Network]]. From 2006, they host the two-hour afternoon program, ''[[Hamish & Andy (radio show)|Hamish & Andy]]'', formerly ''The Hamish & Andy Show'', on the [[Today Network]] in all [[States and territories of Australia|states and territories]] of Australia and in [[New Zealand]].{{cite news |first=|last=|url=http://www.mediaspy.org/report/2009/01/05/hamish-andy-take-on-tasmania/ |title=Hamish & Andy take on Tasmania |accessdate=17 February 2010|work=The Spy Report |publisher=Media Spy |date=5 January 2009}} A weekly highlights package is also broadcast in [[Dubai]].{{cite news |first=|last=|url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/entertainment/confidential/radio-duo-hamish-and-andy-beam-into-britain/story-e6frf96o-1225811894156 |title=Radio duo Hamish and Andy beam into Britain |accessdate=17 February 2010|work=[[The Herald Sun]] |publisher=[[News Corporation]] |date=19 December 2009}} The duo have presented two radio specials on [[BBC 6 Music]] in the United Kingdom on 21 December 2009 and 26 January 2010. On Friday 11 June it was announced on the Christian O'Connell Breakfast Show that Hamish & Andy would be presenting three shows in London during July 2010 to cover Christian's holiday. Hamish and Andy signed a deal to present a series of shows to air on [[Absolute Radio]] Sunday evenings.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2010/jun/22/absolute-radio-hamish-and-andy|title=Absolute Radio signs Australian duo Hamish & Andy|date=22 June 2010|last=Busfield|first=Steve|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=22 June 2010}} ===''The Hamish & Andy Show''=== {{Main|Hamish & Andy (radio show)}} The duo have hosted a two-hour weekday show, ''[[Hamish & Andy (radio show)|The Hamish & Andy Show]]'', since 2006. The show is broadcast in all the seven major cities of Australia, in the afternoon drivetime slot (and a compilation of the past week's best on Saturday mornings in New Zealand). The show is the highest-rated radio series in Australian history, with approximately two million listeners daily.{{Citation needed|date=July 2010}} The show is well known for its interstate and overseas trips. As of 2014, [[Hamish & Andy (radio show)|The Hamish & Andy Show]] has completed two domestic and two foreign caravan tours, [[Bass Strait]] sailboat trip, and trips to Afghanistan, Beijing, Japan, India, and the USA, recording live on location. The program has won 14 Australian Commercial Radio Awards. The duo have released two compilation albums of segments from their daily radio show, ''[[Unessential Listening]]'', in 2008{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=r1466704|pure_url=yes}}|title=Unessential Listening|work=Allmusic|publisher=Macrovision|accessdate=17 February 2010}} and ''[[Celebrating 50 Glorious Years]]'' in 2010. Both albums won [[ARIA Music Awards|ARIA]] Awards for Best Comedy Release. Blake and Lee announced in August 2010 that they would be cutting down their show to a single program each week from 2011 onward, in the Friday afternoon drive time slot. The final daily program aired on 3 December 2010.{{Cite news |title = Hamish and Andy quitting daily radio show |work = The Spy Report |publisher = Media Spy |date = 25 August 2010 |url = http://www.mediaspy.org/report/2010/08/25/hamish-and-andy-quitting-daily-radio-show/ |accessdate = 25 August 2010 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20101104015412/http://www.mediaspy.org/report/2010/08/25/hamish-and-andy-quitting-daily-radio-show/ |archivedate = 4 November 2010 |df = dmy-all }} ===''Business Brunch''/''Happy Hour''=== As of January 2013, the pair moved their weekly drive show from Fridays to Mondays from 4 p.m, and added a one-hour show from 9 a.m. Tuesdays through Fridays.{{cite news | url=http://www.hamishandandy.com/2012/big-announcement/ | title=Big announcement | publisher=Hamish & Andy | date=23 November 2012 | accessdate=23 November 2012 }} This second show is known as ''[[Hamish & Andy (radio show)#Hamish & Andy's Business Brunch|Hamish & Andy's Business Brunch]]'', during which they cover every single topic in the world, one topic per show. The list of topics for every week is updated the week before and listeners are encouraged to contribute any 'expertise' or assistance to the discussion of any particular topic covered on the show.{{cite news|url=http://www.hamishandandy.com/topics|title=Business Brunch Topics|publisher=Hamish & Andy|accessdate=12 March 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130330231130/http://www.hamishandandy.com/topics/|archivedate=30 March 2013|df=dmy-all}} This arrangement lasted six months, until they shifted to a one-hour program at 3 p.m. every weekday afternoon called ''[[Hamish & Andy (radio show)#Hamish & Andy's Happy Hour|Hamish & Andy's Happy Hour]]''. Similar to the Business Brunch, it address one topic each day, but this topic is merely a starting point for the day's conversation. ==Television career== Hamish & Andy have presented a number of television series and specials since 2003. They began on sketch shows but have found greater success in recent years with their travel diary-style programmes. {{Color box|#E0E8FF|border=darkgray}} Series {{Color box|#FFE0E0|border=darkgray}} 7 p.m. Monday | 8 July 2013 | 19 August 2013 | 1,372,000 (season average) |- | align="center" | 2014 | style="background: #E0E8FF" align="center" | ''[[Hamish & Andy's Gap Year#Hamish & Andy's Gap Year South America|Hamish & Andy's Gap Year South America]]'' | align="center" | 6 | 60 mins | 7:30 p.m. Tuesday | 1 July 2014 | 5 August 2014 | 1,000,000 (season average) |- | align="center" | 2017 | style="background: #E0E8FF" align="center" | ''[[True Story with Hamish & Andy]]'' | align="center" | 10 | 30 mins | 7:30 p.m. Monday | 5 June 2017 | TBA | TBA |} ===Early days=== Blake united with Lee in 2003 when they developed a [[Channel 31 (Australia)|Channel 31]] [[sketch show]], called ''Radio Karate'', with friends [[Ryan Shelton]] and Tim Bartley. Blake reunited with Lee in 2004 when they were named hosts of a new [[Seven Network]] variety program, ''The Hamish and Andy Show'', a show described as a successor to ''[[Big Bite]]''. It premiered in 2004, and steadily built a moderate cult audience. However the show did not rate well and was cancelled after its initial run of six episodes.{{cite news |first=Kate |last=Nancarrow |url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/culture/hamish-amp-andy/2007/04/02/1175366136794.html?page=fullpage |title=Hamish & Andy |accessdate=17 February 2010|work=[[The Age]] |publisher=[[Fairfax Media]] |date=2 April 2007}} ===''Rove'' and guest appearances=== [[File:Hamish Blake and Andrew G - Joker Poker 2005.jpg|thumb|left|Hamish Blake, with [[Andrew Günsberg]], appearing on ''[[Joker Poker]]'' in 2005.]] In 2005, they were recruited by comedian [[Rove McManus]], to develop the [[Satire|satirical]] television comedy series, ''[[Real Stories]]'', which aired on Network Ten in 2006. From 2007 to 2009, the duo appeared fortnightly on ''Rove'' in a mixture of pre-recorded segments and live appearances. They hosted the [[Logie Awards|Logie awards]] in 2007 and 2008 (and went on to open the 2013 and 2014 ceremonies), and the [[ARIA Music Awards|ARIA awards]] in 2008. They appeared on ''[[Joker Poker]]'' and ''[[Australia's Brainiest|Australia's Brainiest Comedian]]'' in 2005, ''[[Are You Smarter Than A 5th Grader?]]'' in 2009 and ''[[Good News Week]]'' in 2010. The group appeared on ''[[The Jay Leno Show]]'' twice in 2009, and on ''[[The Project (Australian TV program)|The 7pm Project]]'' numerous times from 2009, in a similar manner as they did on ''Rove''. They appeared on UKs ''[[The Graham Norton Show]]'' in June 2010. ===Network Ten specials=== The duo have presented numerous televised [[clip show]] [[television special|specials]] on Network Ten. ''Hamish and Andy: Re-Gifted'' at the end of 2008, and ''Hamish & Andy: Re-Gifted - Another Very Early Christmas Special'' at the end of 2009, were both produced in conjunction with [[Roving Enterprises]] and consisted mostly of highlights of their fortnightly appearances on [[Rove (TV series)|Rove]]. Their 2010 ''Hamish & Andy's Reministmas Special'' recapped their adventures during the year, mostly as part of their radio show. In addition to these, they produced three travel specials for Ten. ''[[Caravan of Courage (series)#American Caravan of Courage (2009)|Hamish & Andy's American Caravan of Courage]]'' in 2009 (another [[Roving Enterprises]] co-production) summarised their two-week road-trip across the [[United States of America|United States]]. Similarly, 2010's ''[[Caravan of Courage (series)#Caravan of Courage: Great Britain and Ireland (2010)|Hamish & Andy's Caravan of Courage: Great Britain and Ireland]]'' recapped their next caravan trip made as part of their radio show. Their third travel special, ''Learn India with Hamish & Andy'', aired as part of the network's lead-up to the [[2010 Commonwealth Games]] in [[Delhi]].{{cite web|url=http://www.tvtonight.com.au/2010/09/airdate-2010-commonwealth-games.html|title=Airdate: 2010 Commonwealth Games|work=TV Tonight|last=Knox |first=David|date=18 September 2010|accessdate=30 September 2010}} ===Nine Network and ''Gap Year''=== Following a series of media reports, the pair confirmed in February 2011 that they had joined the [[Nine Network]] on a two-year contract, to produce ''[[Hamish and Andy's Gap Year]]''.http://www.tvtonight.com.au/2011/04/hamish-andys-gap-year-for-nine.html The show first aired on 28 July 2011. The show premiered to strong ratings and has since gone onto three more seasons (''[[Hamish & Andy's Gap Year#Hamish & Andy's Euro Gap Year|Hamish & Andy's Euro Gap Year]]'' in 2012 and ''[[Hamish & Andy's Gap Year#Hamish & Andy's Gap Year Asia|Hamish & Andy's Gap Year Asia]]'' in 2013 and ''[[Hamish & Andy's Gap Year#Hamish & Andy's Gap Year South America|Hamish & Andy's Gap Year South America]]'' in 2014). The pair also filmed a fifth [[Caravan of Courage (series)#Caravan of Courage: Australia v New Zealand (2012)|Caravan of Courage]] adventure in 2012, in which they compared their home country, [[Australia]], to their neighbours New Zealand in two 90-minute specials.{{cite news|title=Caravan of Courage Aus Vs NZ, Ep1|url=http://www.hamishandandy.com/2012/caravan-courage-australia-vs-new-zealand-episode-1/|publisher=chris & nelson|accessdate=12 March 2013|date=11 November 2012}} In December 2016, the duo announced that 2017 would be their last year on radio, in order to focus on television. They also announced an as yet unnamed TV show to be aired on the Nine Network in mid 2017.http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/tv/radio/hamish-and-andy-confirm-popular-duo-are-quitting-radio-at-the-end-of-2017/news-story/19e0dc7e93665ff96121fcd90b2db3c0 The duo advertised on their website and radio show, for listeners to contribute "great stories" for "The Great Stories Project"http://www.hamishandandy.com/contact/great-stories-project/ which was the basis of their 2017 television show ''[[True Story with Hamish & Andy]]'' on the Nine Network. ==Other projects== [[File:Hamish & Andy - EJ Whitten Game - together.jpg|thumb|Blake (centre) and Lee (right) played in the 2008 [[E. J. Whitten Legends Game]].]] On 7 July 2007 they presented the [[Live Earth concert, Sydney|Australian leg]] of [[Live Earth]] and also appeared at the Melbourne [[Sound Relief]] concert in 2009. They played in the 2008 and 2009 [[E. J. Whitten Legends Game]]. They also made a mockumentary short film ''The Greystone 2800'', that won the 2005 Melbourne Comedy Festival Short Film competition. They also hosted [[FHM]]'s ''Search for Australia's Funniest Man''. They had a minor acting role on [[soap opera]], ''[[Neighbours]]'', portraying radio presenters Fred and Big Tommo on the episode dated 27 August 2008.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvtonight.com.au/2008/08/hamish-andy-on-ramsay.html|title=Hamish & Andy on Ramsay|work=TV Tonight|last=Knox |first=David|date=10 August 2008|accessdate=17 February 2010}} The episode featured them promoting university drop-out [[Ty Harper]]'s ([[Dean Geyer]]) band, and interviewing schoolgirls [[Rachel Kinski]] ([[Caitlin Stasey]]) and [[Donna Freedman]] ([[Margot Robbie]]) about their situation with Harper. They make a [[cameo appearance]] in the 2010 short film ''IA: Interview Artist''. They have also made appearances on many [[Austereo]] radio shows, occasionally filling in for [[The Kyle & Jackie O Show|Kyle & Jackie O]], [[The Matt & Jo Show|Matt & Jo]] or [[Fifi and Jules]] when a regular presenter fell ill. Hamish and Andy hosted the richest horse suit race in Australia in the small Victorian country town of Wedderburn. It drew about 7000 people and featured performances from themselves, Jessica Mauboy, and Birds of Tokyo. ==See also== *[[Hamish & Andy (radio show)]] *[[Hamish & Andy's Gap Year]] *[[Caravan of Courage (series)|Caravan of Courage]] *[[Roy and HG]] ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{Commons category}} *[http://www.hamishandandy.com.au/ Hamish & Andy's official site] *[http://www.realstories.com.au/ Real Stories] {{Hamish & Andy}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hamish and Andy}} [[Category:Hamish & Andy| ]] [[Category:ARIA Award winners]] [[Category:Australian male comedians]] [[Category:Australian radio presenters]] [[Category:Pranksters]] [[Category:RMITV alumni]]

| club1 = [[Jammu and Kashmir cricket team|Jammu and Kashmir]] | year1 = 2006-07 – present | clubnumber1 = | club2 = [[North Zone cricket team|North Zone]] | year2 = 2013-14 – present | clubnumber2 = | columns = 3 | column1 = [[First-class cricket|FC]] | matches1 = 64 | runs1 = 4232 | bat avg1 = 40.69 | 100s/50s1 = 14/18 | top score1 = 170 | deliveries1 = 288 | wickets1 = 2 | bowl avg1 = 84.00 | fivefor1 = 0 | tenfor1 = 0 | best bowling1 = 1/16 | catches/stumpings1 = 53/1 | column2 = [[List A cricket|List A]] | matches2 = 51 | runs2 = 1208 | bat avg2 = 25.70 | 100s/50s2 = 2/7 | top score2 = 112 | deliveries2 = 137 | wickets2 = 2 | bowl avg2 = 60.00 | fivefor2 = 0 | tenfor2 = n/a | best bowling2 = 2/44 | catches/stumpings2 = 17/2 | column3 = [[Twenty20|T20]] | matches3 = 38 | runs3 = 639 | bat avg3 = 18.25 | 100s/50s3 = 0/2 | top score3 = 75[[not out|*]] | deliveries3 = 25 | wickets3 = 1 | bowl avg3 = 38.00 | fivefor3 = 0 | tenfor3 = n/a | best bowling3 = 1/14 | catches/stumpings3 = 19/2 | date = 28 April 2017 | source = http://www.espncricinfo.com/india/content/player/279566.html Cricinfo }} '''Ian Dev Singh''' is an [[Cricket in India|Indian cricketer]] who plays predominantly as a [[batsman]]. He was captain of [[Jammu and Kashmir cricket team|Jammu and Kashmir]] in the [[Ranji Trophy]] in [[2013–14 Ranji Trophy|2013-14]].
== Early life == Ian Dev Singh was born in [[Gandhinagar]], and named after [[Ian Botham]] and [[Kapil Dev]], his father's two favourite cricketers. He completed his [[Bachelor of Engineering]] degree at [[D. Y. Patil]] University in [[Navi Mumbai]] while simultaneously playing Ranji Trophy cricket, occasionally necessitating flying in to sit an exam directly between Jammu and Kashmir fixtures.<ref name=TOI>http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/icc-world-cup-2015/top-stories/JK-skipper-Ian-Dev-is-another-talent-on-the-rise/articleshow/22606442.cms</ref>
==Career== Jammu and Kashmir's cricketing infrastructure remains somewhat underdeveloped, and Dev Singh developed as a cricketer by playing club cricket in Mumbai. He noted in 2012 that, '[t]he competition even at the club level [in Mumbai] is very tough whereas back in our state, we get limited opportunities. We rarely get solid preparation before the Ranji season commences.'<ref name=Zeenews>http://zeenews.india.com/sports/cricket/bedi-has-changed-mindset-of-jandk-cricketers-says-ian-dev-singh_736353.html</ref>
Another major influence on the development of his game was former India captain [[Bishan Bedi]], coach of Jammu and Kashmir between 2011 and 2014. With Bedi's guidance helping him overhaul his mental approach to batting, Dev Singh scored 406 runs at 67.66 in first-class matches in 2011-12, and earned selection for North Zone in the [[Duleep Trophy]].<ref name=Zeenews /> For his part, Bedi described Dev Singh as 'a very good shorter version batsman and a brilliant fielder' who was 'definitely ready for a break', either in the form of an international call-up or an [[Indian Premier League|IPL]] contract.<ref name=TOI /> As of 2017, however, such honours have eluded him.

{{small|(Bachelor of Mass Communication)}} | occupation = Journalist and politician | years_active = 1995 — present | nationality = [[Uganda]]n | citizenship = Uganda | residence = [[Kirinnya]],{{cite web | url=http://www.monitor.co.ug/News/National/MP-Ssemujju-Nganda-arrested-again/-/688334/1537200/-/m7d4p/-/index.html | title=Teargas In Bweyogere As MP Nganda Is Arrested | accessdate=21 March 2015 | date=19 February 2012 | first=Frederic | last=Musisi | newspaper=[[Daily Monitor]] (Kampala)}} Uganda | known_for = Politics | networth = | home_town = [[Kyazanga]] | title = [[Parliament of Uganda|Member of Parliament]]
Kiira Municipality | spouse = {{small|Faridah Ssemujju}} }} '''Ibrahim Ssemujju Nganda''', commonly known as '''Ibrahim Ssemujju''', is a Ugandan journalist and politician. He is the [[member of Parliament]] representing Kyaddondo County East in the 9th Parliament (2011 to 2016).{{cite web | date=2011 | url=http://www.parliament.go.ug/mpdata/mps.hei?p=f&n=t&details=t&j=756.000000&const=Kyadondo++County+East+&dist_id=13.000000&distname=Wakiso | title=Profile of Ibrahim Ssemujju Nganda, Member of Parliament for Kyaddondo County East, Wakiso District | accessdate=17 March 2015 | last=POU | publisher=[[Parliament of Uganda]] (POU)}} ==Background and education== Ssemujju was born in Bijaaba Village, [[Kyazanga|Kyazanga Municipality]], [[Lwengo District]], on 23 September 1973. At that time, Lwengo District was still part of [[Masaka District]]. He is the son of Hajji Ali Nganda Nkwanga and Hajati Sophia Nalwooga, one of his forty-eight children and one of her sixteen offspring.{{cite web | accessdate=17 March 2015 | url=http://www.observer.ug/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=11678:ssemujju-ibrahim-nganda-all-that-you-didnt-know-about-this-journalist-turned-politician&catid=34:news&Itemid=59 | title=Ssemujju Ibrahim Nganda: All That You Didn’t Know About This Journalist-Turned-Politician | date=13 January 2011 | publisher=[[The Observer (Uganda)]] | first=Richard M. | last=Kavuma}} He attended the Bijaaba Islamic Institute, "a few meters from his birthplace", obtaining the Primary Leaving Certificate while there. After the institute started a secondary school section, Ssemujju joined. However, by Senior 2, most of his female classmates had found husbands and dropped out, while his male cohorts left for odd jobs in nearby [[Masaka|Masaka Town]]. He raised whatever little capital he could and convinced his father to enroll him in [[Masaka Secondary School]] for his Senior 3 studies. At that time, he barely spoke any English, but they admitted him anyway. He progressively did well and passed his O-Level examinations in 1992. He went on to pursue his A-Level education, also at Masaka Secondary School. He graduated at the top of his class in 1995. He was admitted to [[Makerere University]], on a full Ugandan government scholarship to study [[mass communication]]. He graduated in 1998 with a [[Bachelor of Arts]] mass communication. ==Career== Straight out of Makerere, he was hired as a reporter for the ''[[Daily Monitor]]'', one of the two leading English language daily newspapers in Uganda, serving in that role until 2004. His beat was coverage of the [[Parliament of Uganda|Ugandan parliament]]. From 2000 until 2001, he taught journalism at the [[Islamic University in Uganda]]. In 2004, he left the ''Daily Monitor'' to join ''[[The Observer (Uganda)|The Observer]]'', both as a reporter and as a shareholder. He was assigned the role of political editor at the ''Weekly Observer'', serving in that role until 2011. In 2009, he was assigned additional duties as the editor, educational news. In 2011, he resigned from his journalism assignments to contest the parliamentary seat of Kyaddondo County East. He ran on the [[Forum for Democratic Change]] (FDC) political party platform. He won and is the current [[incumbent]]. Prior to the February 2016 presidential, parliamentary, and local elections, [[Kira Town|Kira Municipality]] was awarded a parliamentary seat, separate from Kyaddondo East. Ssemujju is contesting for that seat under the FDC political party banner.{{cite web | accessdate=22 January 2016 | location=Kampala | first=Mercy | url=http://www.monitor.co.ug/SpecialReports/Elections/Ssemujju-setting-the-pace-in-contest-for-new-Kira-municipality/-/859108/3043440/-/item/0/-/1grcewz/-/index.html | last=Nalugo | date=22 January 2016 | title=Ssemujju setting the pace in contest for new Kira municipality | newspaper=[[Daily Monitor]]}} ==Other considerations== In parliament, he chairs the Committee on Commissions, Statutory Authorities and State Enterprises. He is also a member of the Committee on Defence and Internal Affairs and of the Business Committee. He is married to Faridah Ssemujju, and together are the parents of two daughters and two sons. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.parliament.go.ug/new/ Website of the Parliament of Uganda] *[http://www.observer.ug/component/content/article?id=21641:mp-ssemujju-nganda-violently-arrested MP Ssemujju Nganda Violently Arrested - 19 October 2012] *[http://www.newvision.co.ug/mobile/Detail.aspx?NewsID=653846&CatID=1 Ssekandi Hails Churches for Social, Spiritual Development] {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ssemujju, Ibrahim}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Makerere University alumni]] [[Category:Ugandan journalists]] [[Category:Ugandan politicians]] [[Category:People from Lwengo District]] [[Category:Ganda people]] [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:Forum for Democratic Change politicians]] [[Category:Members of the Parliament of Uganda]] [[Category:Ugandan Muslims]] [[Category:Islamic University in Uganda academics]]
