{{Use mdy dates|date=July 2013}} {{For|other people named Sandra Lee|Sandra Lee (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Sandra Lee | image = Sandra Lee 2012 Shankbone.JPG | image_size = | caption = Lee at the [[2012 Time 100]] gala | office = [[First Lady]] of [[New York (state)|New York]]
{{small|de facto}} | term_label = Assumed role | term = January 1, 2011 | term_end = | predecessor = [[Michelle Paige Paterson]] | successor = | governor = [[Andrew Cuomo]] | birth_name = Sandra Lee Christiansen | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1966|7|3}} | birth_place = [[Santa Monica, California|Santa Monica]], [[California]], [[United States|U.S.]] | death_date = | death_place = | other_names = | partner = [[Andrew Cuomo]] (2005–present) | education = [[University of Wisconsin–La Crosse]] | occupation = Television personality, author, celebrity chef | website = {{URL|sandralee.com}} }} '''Sandra Lee Christiansen''' (born July 3, 1966){{cite news|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/seattle/stories/2007/05/14/tidbits1.html|title=Food Network star Sandra Lee peeled onions as a youth at the Puyallup Fair|last=Payne|first=Patti|newspaper=Puget Sound Business Journal|publisher=American City Business Journals|location=Seattle, WA|date=May 11, 2007|accessdate=October 12, 2010|archivedate=August 6, 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140806200808/http://www.bizjournals.com/seattle/stories/2007/05/14/tidbits1.html|deadurl=no}}{{cite web|url=http://www.biography.com/people/sandra-lee--20906429|title=Sandra Lee Biography: Chef, Writer, Television Personality profile|publisher=Biography.com|accessdate=May 12, 2015}} is an American [[celebrity chef|television chef]] and [[author]]. She is known for her "Semi-Homemade" cooking concept, which Lee describes as using 70 percent pre-packaged products and 30 percent fresh items.{{Cite web|title = Sandra Lee: The Woman in White|url = http://www.vogue.com/865456/sandra-lee-the-woman-in-white/|website = Vogue|accessdate = 2016-01-08|language = en-US}} ==Early life== Christiansen was born in [[Santa Monica, California]], the daughter of Vicky and Wayne Christiansen. When Sandra was 2, her mother had her and her younger sister Cindy live with their paternal grandmother, Lorraine. By 1972, the girls' parents had divorced; their mother remarried, moving them to [[Sumner, Washington]]. When Lee was 11, her mother divorced for a second time. Lee by this time had three additional siblings, Kimmy, Richie and Johnny. At 15, following a beating by her mother, Lee moved in with her boyfriend, Duane, and on June 30, 1982, left for Wisconsin to live with her father and his girlfriend. She graduated from Onalaska High School in [[Onalaska, Wisconsin]],{{cite web|url=http://onalaskaalumni.com/sandra-lee/|title=Onalaska High School Alumni Association – Sandra Lee|work=Onalaska High School Alumni Association}} and later attended the [[University of Wisconsin-La Crosse]].{{cite news|url=http://abcnews.go.com/GMA/Recipes/story?id=3799773&page=1&singlePage=true|title=Excerpt: 'Made From Scratch'|work=[[Good Morning America]]|date=October 31, 2007|publisher=ABC|accessdate=July 12, 2010|archivedate=May 12, 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150512170317/http://abcnews.go.com/GMA/Recipes/story?id=3799773&page=1&singlePage=true|deadurl=no}}{{cite journal|url=http://sandraleepictures.com/press/FC_1107.htm|title=Recipe for Success|journal=Family Circle|date=November 1, 2007|last=Lee|first=Sandra|accessdate=2010-07-12|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110716002837/http://sandraleepictures.com/press/FC_1107.htm|archivedate=July 16, 2011|df=mdy-all}}{{cite news|url=http://www.nypost.com/pagesixmag/issues/20091203/Sandra+Lee+and+Andrew+Cuomo+Love+Story|title=Sandra Lee and Andrew Cuomo: A Love Story|newspaper=Page Six Magazine|publisher=New York Post|location=New York|accessdate=July 12, 2010|last=Karni|first=Annie|date=December 3, 2009|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100802023113/http://www.nypost.com/pagesixmag/issues/20091203/Sandra+Lee+and+Andrew+Cuomo+Love+Story|archivedate=August 2, 2010|df=mdy-all}} She was raised as a [[Seventh-Day Adventist]] and later her family became [[Jehovah's Witness]].{{Cite web|last=Hoffman |first= Allison |authorlink= |title=Semi-Homemade, Totally Jewish - Turns out Sandra Lee converted a decade ago |publisher=[[The Tablet]]|date=April 5, 2011 |url=http://www.tabletmag.com/scroll/64047/the-jewish-martha-stewart |accessdate=}} In December of her junior year, she left college to live near family in [[Malibu, California]]. She later attended a two week recreational course at [[Le Cordon Bleu]] in [[Ottawa|Ottawa, Ontario]], Canada which she did not finish.{{cite news|first=Gully|last=Wells|url=http://www.vogue.com/magazine/article/sandra-lee-the-woman-in-white/|title=Sandra Lee: The Woman in White|work=[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]|date=February 22, 2011|accessdate=November 24, 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121223151013/http://www.vogue.com/magazine/article/sandra-lee-the-woman-in-white/|archivedate=December 23, 2012|df=mdy-all}} ==Career== In the early 1990s, Lee created a product called "Sandra Lee Kraft Kurtains", a home-decorating tool that used a wire rack and sheets or other fabric samples to create decorative drapery. The product was sold via [[infomercial]]s and cable shopping networks. Home-shopping network [[QVC]] hired her as on-air talent; in her first 18 months on the network, Lee sold $20 million worth of products.{{cite magazine|url=http://www.gourmet.com/magazine/2000s/2003/09/goodbye |title=Good-bye To All That|last=Rochlin|first=Margy|magazine=Gourmet|date=September 2003 |publisher=Condé Nast}} ''Semi-Homemade Cooking with Sandra Lee'' premiered on the [[Food Network]] in 2003. Each episode contains an [[handicraft|arts and crafts]] element, in which Lee decorates the table setting in accordance with the theme of the meal that she just prepared. She refers to these as "tablescapes". Lee's second Food Network series, ''Sandra's Money Saving Meals'', began airing on May 10, 2009.{{cite web|url=http://www.foodnetwork.com/chefs/sandra-lee/index.html|title=Sandra Lee|work=Hosts & Chefs|publisher=[[Food Network]]|accessdate=October 12, 2010|year=2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100825054222/http://www.foodnetwork.com/chefs/sandra-lee/index.html|archivedate=August 25, 2010|df=mdy-all}} She has released 25 books, including Sandra Lee ''Semi-Homemade: Cool Kids Cooking'' (October 2006) and a memoir, ''Made From Scratch'', which was released in November 2007. A magazine based on her show, ''Sandra Lee Semi-Homemade'', was released in 2009.{{cite press release|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/pressRelease/idUS125788+17-Feb-2009+PRN20090217|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130201065903/http://www.reuters.com/article/pressRelease/idUS125788+17-Feb-2009+PRN20090217|dead-url=yes|archive-date=February 1, 2013|title=Television Star and Best-Selling Author Sandra Lee and Hoffman Media, Launches New Magazine Sandra Lee Semi-Homemade Today|publisher=Hoffman Media|agency=Reuters.com|accessdate=October 12, 2010|date=February 17, 2009}} In 2012, Lee won the [[Daytime Emmy Award]] for Outstanding Lifestyle/Culinary Host for Semi-Homemade Cooking.{{cite news|last=Moore|first=Frazier|title=Daytime Emmys 2012 Winners Revealed|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/06/23/daytime-emmys-2012-winners_n_1621807.html|publisher=The Huffington Post|accessdate=2012-09-19|date=June 23, 2012}} Also in 2012, she started a new monthly lifestyle magazine in partnership with TV Guide. She is also starring in two new shows: ''Sandra’s Restaurant Remakes'' and ''Sandra Lee’s Taverns, Lounges & Clubs.''{{cite news|last=Shain|first=Michael|title=Sandra Lee expands empire|url=http://www.nypost.com/p/entertainment/tv/sandra_lee_getting_out_from_behind_VYD2l1irJrfb1ncYsiEZaI|work=New York Post|accessdate=2012-09-26}} In November 2016, Lee won the [[Women's Entrepreneurship Day]] [[Women's Entrepreneurship Day#List of Pioneer Award Winners| Pioneer Award]] held at the [[United Nations]] in [[New York City]].{{cite news |url=http://www.womenseday.org/community/wed-annual-pioneer-awards/|title=Women's Entrepreneurship Day Organization Pioneer Awards 2016 Winners |accessdate=July 5, 2018 |author=Wendy Diamond |publisher=WED}} ==Critical reaction== When the ''[[Seattle Post-Intelligencer]]'' ran a review of Lee's cookbook ''Semi-Homemade Cooking'' that criticized both her recipe and her "Semi-Homemade" concept,{{cite news|url=http://www.seattlepi.com/food/92388_chou23.shtml|newspaper=[[Seattle Post-Intelligencer]]|title=On Food: 'Semi-Homemade' is a halfhearted view of cooking|last=Chou|first=Hsiao-Ching|date=October 23, 2002|accessdate=October 12, 2010|publisher=Hearst Seattle Media|location=Seattle, WA}} the review's author received a response "that was more impassioned than I anticipated", with most readers agreeing with the article. However, a number of readers disagreed with the column. One reader wrote, "Lots of people who don't want to take the time to shred a cup of carrots want to cook a good meal."{{cite news|url=http://www.seattlepi.com/food/95256_chou13.shtml|title=On Food: Column on Sandra Lee really stirred the pot|newspaper=Seattle Post-Intelligencer|last=Chou|first=Hsiao-Ching|date=November 13, 2002|accessdate=October 12, 2010|publisher=Hearst Seattle Media|location=Seattle, WA}} Kurt Soller, writing for ''[[Newsweek]]'', compared Lee's impact upon television cooking with that of [[Julia Child]], noting that although Lee's show "is the furthest from Child's methods", both women "filled a niche that hasn't yet been explored". ===Kwanzaa Cake=== Much of the criticism of Lee has coalesced around a recipe for "[[Kwanzaa]] Cake" that she demonstrated on a 2003 episode of ''Semi-Homemade Cooking with Sandra Lee''. The recipe consisted of [[Angel food cake|angel food]] cake topped with icing, cinnamon, apple pie filling, pumpkin seeds and [[Corn nut|corn nuts]] (all store-bought), with seven Kwanzaa candles then inserted into the cake.[http://www.avclub.com/article/this-cake-will-make-your-eyeballs-burst-into-flame-25176 This Cake Will Make Your Eyeballs Burst Into Flames], Amelie Gillette ''The Onion AV Club'', March 16, 2009 Food writer [[Anthony Bourdain]], who was harshly critical of Lee in general, described the video clip of this segment of the show as "eye searing" and "a war crime".{{cite news|title=Eat this, Anthony Bourdain!|first=Moriah |last=Balingit|work=McClatchy – Tribune Business News|location=Washington|date=June 17, 2010}}{{cite news|title=Ripping Rant on Food and Restaurant Business; Surly celebrity chef Anthony Bourdain spouts off about his likes, and mostly passionate dislikes, in the eminently entertaining Medium Raw.|first=Colette|last=Bancroft|work=St. Petersburg Times|location=Florida|date=July 7, 2010|page=E2}}{{Cite book|last1=Bourdain|first1=Anthony|title=Medium Raw: A Bloody Valentine to the World of Food and the People Who Cook|publisher=Ecco|isbn=978-0-06-171894-6}} The cake was called "scary" by the ''[[Houston Chronicle]]'',{{cite news|title=Celebrity Chefs/Foodies with groupies|first=Mary|last=Vuong|work=[[Houston Chronicle]]|location=Texas|date=May 17, 2006|page=1}} and "the most ghastly-sounding dish in Lee's culinary repertoire" by ''Tulsa World''.{{cite news|title=Perhaps Democrats should taste Sandra Lee's cooking|first=Charlotte|last=Allen|work=[[Tulsa World]]|location=Oklahoma|date=December 5, 2010|page=G.3}} ''Salon.com'' wrote that the video "takes pride of place in the pantheon of hilarious culinary disaster videos".{{cite news|title=Just how offensive is Sandra Lee's crazy Kwanzaa cake?|date=December 26, 2010|first=Francis|last=Lam|publisher=Salon.com|url=http://www.salon.com/food/francis_lam/2010/12/26/sandra_lee_kwanzaa_cake_offensive|accessdate=May 12, 2015}} Cookbook author Denise Vivaldo, who claims to have ghostwritten recipes for many celebrity chefs, wrote a humorous post in ''[[The Huffington Post]]'' in December 2010 stating that she was responsible for the recipe (though she said that the candles were Lee's idea), and apologizing for it. She also wrote that Lee "has incredibly bad food taste".[http://www.eurweb.com/2010/12/woman-behind-sandra-lee%E2%80%99s-%E2%80%98kwanzaa-cake%E2%80%99-explains-debacle/ Woman behind ‘Sandra Lee Kwanzaa Cake’ Explains Debacle], ''Lee Bailey's EURweb'' A week later, the post was removed, after Lee's lawyer threatened legal action.{{cite news|url=http://nymag.com/news/features/sandra-lee-2011-4/index6.html|title=The Ravenous and Resourceful Sandra Lee|first=Benjamin|last=Wallace|work=[[New York (magazine)|New York]]|date=March 27, 2011}} Lee has said this recipe is the only one of hers whose criticism she has taken to heart, and that the recipe was partly due to the Food Network dictating the show's content at the time. ==Personal life== From 2001 to 2005, she was married to [[KB Home]] CEO and philanthropist [[Bruce Karatz]]{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/05/15/nyregion/15sandralee.html?pagewanted=all|title=A TV Cook’s Next Serving? Cuomo Family Style|last=Barbaro|first=Michael|date=May 14, 2010|accessdate=28 September 2014}} for whom she converted to Judaism.{{Cite web|last=Wallace |first=Benjamin |authorlink= |title=The Ravenous and Resourceful Sandra Lee |publisher=[[New York Magazine]]|date=March 27, 2011 |url=http://nymag.com/news/features/sandra-lee-2011-4/index3.html |quote=By 1999, Lee had become a spokesperson for KB Home, as well as romantically involved with its CEO, Bruce Karatz, who was 21 years her senior. Karatz’s marriage subsequently dissolved, and by 2001, Lee had converted to Judaism and married Karatz at [[Ron Burkle]]’s estate in Beverly Hills.}} In the fall of 2005, Lee entered into a relationship with the future [[Governor of New York]], [[Andrew Cuomo]]. The two share homes in [[Chappaqua, New York|Chappaqua]] and [[Poughkeepsie, New York|Poughkeepsie]].{{cite journal|url=http://www.newsweek.com/id/210852|title=Sandra Lee: The Anti-Julia|journal=Newsweek|last=Soller|first=Kurt|date=August 6, 2009|accessdate=October 12, 2010}} ===Cancer=== Lee announced on May 12, 2015, that she had been diagnosed with early-stage [[breast cancer]]. By then she had undergone a [[lumpectomy]], and was scheduled to have a double [[mastectomy]] later in the week. Governor Cuomo was to take some personal time to be with her during and after the surgery.{{cite web | url= http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/tv-personality-sandra-lee-battling-breast-cancer-urges/story?id=30968304| title=TV Personality Sandra Lee Battling Breast Cancer, Urges Women to Be Screened|date=May 12, 2015|work=Good Morning America|accessdate=May 12, 2015|archivedate= May 12, 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150512172908/http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/tv-personality-sandra-lee-battling-breast-cancer-urges/story?id=30968304|deadurl=no}} On October 12, 2015, she was rushed to a hospital because of fluid buildup, believed to be a complication of her recovery, and was monitored closely in the next few days. Cuomo had been attending a [[Billy Joel]] concert at [[Nassau Coliseum]], but left and went to the hospital.{{cite web|url=http://www.msn.com/en-us/tv/news/sandra-lee-cuomos-girlfriend-rushed-to-hospital-source/ar-BBlpp4N|title=Sandra Lee, Cuomo's girlfriend, rushed to hospital: source|work=msn.com}} Lee has been cancer free since mid-2016.{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/sandra-lee-reveals-cancer-free/story?id=33942286|title=Sandra Lee Reveals She Is Cancer Free: source|work=abcnews.com/}} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *{{official website|http://www.sandralee.com}} *[http://www.foodnetwork.com/chefs/sandra-lee.html Sandra Lee's Food Network Page] {{Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lifestyle/Culinary Show Host}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lee, Sandra}} [[Category:1966 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American television chefs]] [[Category:American women writers]] [[Category:Andrew Cuomo]] [[Category:Food Network chefs]] [[Category:New York (state) Democrats]] [[Category:People from Chappaqua, New York]] [[Category:People from Pierce County, Washington]] [[Category:People from Santa Monica, California]] [[Category:People with cancer]] [[Category:Place of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:University of Wisconsin–La Crosse alumni]] [[Category:Women chefs]] [[Category:Women cookbook writers]] [[Category:People from Onalaska, Wisconsin]]

{{Infobox musical artist | name = Teru | image = Teru.jpg | alt = | caption = Teru in [[Santiago]], Chile, 2010 | image_size = | background = non_vocal_instrumentalist | birth_name = | alias = TERU, wait A minute | birth_date = April 10 | birth_place = [[Kyoto Prefecture|Kyoto]], [[Japan]] | origin = | death_date = | death_place = | genre = {{flatlist| * [[Neo-classical metal]] * [[symphonic metal]] * [[power metal]]}} | occupation = {{flatlist| * Musician * guitarist * songwriter * [[designer]] * actor}} | instrument = {{flatlist| * Guitar}} | years_active = 2001–present | label = | associated_acts = {{flatlist| * [[Jupiter (band)|Jupiter]] * [[Versailles (band)|Versailles]] * [[Node of Scherzo]] * [[Hizaki|Hizaki Grace Project]] * [[Aikaryu]]}} | url = }} '''Teru''' (stylized as '''TERU''') is a Japanese [[visual kei]] [[heavy metal music|metal]] musician, songwriter and artist. He is best known as guitarist for the [[symphonic metal]] band [[Versailles (band)|Versailles]]. He is also a member of [[Jupiter (band)|Jupiter]]. Before Versailles he was previously in [[Aikaryu]] and supported his future bandmate [[Hizaki]] in his solo project. ==Biography== Teru joined {{Nihongo|[[Aikaryu]]|藍華柳}} in 2002, replacing guitarist Death.{{cite web| title = Aikaryu JaME biography| work = jame-world.com| url = http://www.jame-world.com/us/artists-biography-400-aikaryu.html| date = 2009-01-29| accessdate = 2011-12-31}} In August 2003 they signed to Crow Music (the same label as [[Hizaki]]'s band Crack Brain) and released their first single the following month. For the next three years they toured extensively, had numerous releases and several line-up changes. But in early 2006, they were involved in a car accident with most members having serious injuries. While the members recovered Teru participated in Hizaki's solo project, Hizaki Grace Project. In December Aikaryu regrouped and performed a small tour. But in April 2007, they decided to disband. Teru joined Hizaki's solo band, Hizaki Grace Project, in October 2006. Which also included [[Jasmine You|Yuu]] (Jakura) on bass, Mikage (Babylon) on drums and [[Shaura|Juka]] ([[Moi dix Mois]]) on vocals. They released three albums; ''Dignity of Crest'', ''Ruined Kingdom'' and ''Curse of Virgo'', and on December 24, 2007 had their latest live performance. In 2007, he was recruited for [[Versailles (band)|Versailles]] by Hizaki and [[Kamijo (musician)|Kamijo]], after being recommended by the Rock May-Kan venue. They quickly developed a large following worldwide, having their debut EP released domestically in Europe,{{cite web| title = Versailles mini-album Japan & Europe Release| work = jame-world.com| url = http://www.jame-world.com/uk/news-24289-versailles-mini-album-japan-europe-release.html| accessdate = 2011-12-31}} and to date have gone on two world tours, which took them across Asia, Europe and Latin America.{{cite web| title = Versailles reveals dates for their World Tour| work = tokyofever.com| url = http://www.tokyofever.com/2011/07/versailles-updates-with-locations-for-world-tour-2011/| accessdate = 2011-12-31}} Teru is also an artist, having designed many releases for Kamijo's record label [http://artist-society.com/ Sherow Artist Society] under the alias "Wait a Minute" (stylized as wait A minute), including for Versailles, Hizaki Grace Project and [[Matenrou Opera]]. He even gave a lecture at a seminar on the development of Japanese pop culture, held by the [[Kyoto University of Art and Design]] on November 25, 2010.{{cite web| script-title=ja:コンテンツ業界セミナー開催| language = Japanese| work = kyoto-art.ac.jp| url = http://www.kyoto-art.ac.jp/student/career/news/101118-001859.html| accessdate = 2011-12-31}} He also designed the artwork for the 2015 album, Venom, by American heavy metal band, [[Impellitteri]] In January 2011, he and the rest of Versailles started starring in their own TV mini drama called {{Nihongo|''Onegai Kanaete Versailles''|おねがいかなえてヴェルサイユ||"Fulfill My Wish Versailles"}}. The show also starred [[Rina Koike]] and aired on [[Mainichi Broadcasting System]] and [[TV Kanagawa]] until March.{{cite web| title = Versailles to act in a drama| work = shattered-tranquility.net| url = http://shattered-tranquility.net/index.php/01/03/versailles-to-act-in-a-drama/| accessdate = 2011-12-31}} Both Teru and Hizaki participated in the Blue Planet Japan project, which was created in response to the [[2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami]]. The project is comprised on many [[visual kei]] artists, including members of [[DaizyStripper]], [[heidi.]], Matenrou Opera, and [[Dolly (Japanese band)|Dolly]]. They performed live at Shibuya O-West on June 25 and released the single "Hitotsu Dake ~We are the One~" on September 14, with the proceeds from the single donated to the victims.{{cite web| title = Visual-Kei Collab Band BLUE PLANET JAPAN Peforms [sic] "We Are The One"| work = jpopasia.com| url = http://www.jpopasia.com/news/visual-kei-collab-band-blue-planet-japan-peforms-we-are-the-one::7658.html| accessdate = 2011-12-31}}{{cite web| title = Visual Kei Charity Single| work = jame-world.com| url = http://www.jame-world.com/uk/news-78383-visual-kei-charity-single.html| accessdate = 2011-12-31}} On August 9, 2011, the second anniversary of [[Jasmine You]]'s death, Teru composed and dedicated the song "「For You」" to his former bandmate.{{youtube|aNIii2KLOQ8|TERU /「for you」}} On July 20, 2012, Versailles announced they were stopping all activities at the end of the year. On April 1, 2013, every member of Versailles minus singer Kamijo announced they had formed a new band named [[Jupiter (band)|Jupiter]].{{cite web| title = New Band from Versailles Members| work = jame-world.com| url = http://www.jame-world.com/us/news-95031-new-band-from-versailles-members.html| accessdate = 2013-04-24}}{{cite web| title = Versailles members create new band, ‘Jupiter’| work = tokyohive.com| url = http://www.tokyohive.com/2013/04/versailles-members-create-new-band-jupiter/| accessdate = 2013-04-24}} They recruited Zin as vocalist and released their debut single, "Blessing of the Future", in the summer. ==Equipment== ;Current - ESP 激鉄 "Geki-Tetsu" Teru Custom Black ;Other - ESP Antelope Black

- ENGL, Hughes & Kettner, Bogner, Brunetti, Mesa Boogie & Marshall Amps ==Discography== ===With Aikaryu=== {{main|Aikaryu#Discography}} ===With Hizaki Grace Project=== ;Albums * ''Dignity of Crest'' (January 1, 2007) * ''Ruined Kingdom'' (September 19, 2007) * ''Curse of Virgo'' (December 26, 2007) ;DVD * {{Nihongo|''Eien no Kokuin''|永遠の刻印||February 17, 2007, distributed at concert}} * {{Nihongo|''Monshou''|紋章||May 9, 2007}} ===With Versailles=== {{main|Versailles discography}} ===With Jupiter=== {{main|Jupiter (band)#Discography}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://ameblo.jp/versailles-teru/ Official blog] * [http://ameblo.jp/versailles-teru/ Official Twitter] * [http://www.bpjapan.info/ Blue Planet Japan official website] {{Versailles}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Teru}} [[Category:Versailles (band) members]] [[Category:Visual kei musicians]] [[Category:Japanese heavy metal guitarists]] [[Category:Japanese rock guitarists]] [[Category:Japanese designers]] [[Category:Japanese male actors]] [[Category:Musicians from Kyoto Prefecture]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Unidentified people]]

{{Expand Italian|Monaca di Dresda|date=December 2009}} {{POV|modern bias promoting vaccinium ex eventu|date=June 2015}} {{Infobox book | name = ''Le profezie della monaca di Dresda'' [The Prophecies of the Nun of Dresden] | image = | caption = | alt = | author = Renzo Baschera | country = [[Italy]] | language = [[Italian language|Italian]] | genre = [[astrology]] | publisher = MEB | release_date = 1976, 1978, 1986 | media_type = Novel | pages = 200 (third edition) }}
The '''''Prophecies of the Nun of Dresden''''', under the original Italian title of ''Le profezie della monaca di Dresda'', is a novel by Renzo Baschera which takes the form of an essay analyzing several manuscripts purportedly found at the beginning of the 19th century. These manuscripts contain prophecies about the last Popes, the great European dynasties, technological progress, several disasters and the end of time, from the end of the 17th century to the end of the 30th century.
==Structure of the book==
===Introduction=== The ''Prophecies of the [[Nun]] of [[Dresden]]'' begins with an introduction, which shows the few historical notes of the prophetic manuscripts. These writings, according to Baschera's novel, were mentioned for the first time by a certain [[Abbot]] Nicolas Holb in 1808 in [[Vienna]]. The author of the manuscripts, written in the form of letters, was a [[Germans|German]] nun and [[clairvoyant]] whose actual name is not known. Of her, it is only known that she was “a pious [[Religious (Catholicism)|Religious]] born in Dresden in 1680 and died in 1706” and that “ . . . her [[convent]] was on the banks of the [[Elbe]]” River.<ref name="pag7">Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 7</ref> Some of the letters were written in [[German language|German]], some more in [[Latin]] and the others in both languages. This is surprising, especially considering the humble origins of the nun, who is thought to be illiterate.<ref name="pag8">Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 8. According to an unreferenced description by Baschera, in a convent in Dresden there was "a young nun, from a humble family, chosen by a celestial voice to send messages to the rulers of Earth".</ref>
In the third edition of the novel, the author adds a premise which claims to interpret the contemporary events (1986) in the light of the writings of the Nun, expecting the fulfillment of the predictions by the end of the 20th century.<ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', pp. 9-11.</ref>
===Analysis of the letters=== In the main section of the novel, the author analyzes the documents in his possession, a series of thirty-one letters written to the people who lived at the end of the 17th century and the beginning of the 18th century. Some of them are in good condition, some are very damaged and others are copied. The analysis is divided into three groups:
Letters to the [[King]]s and [[Pope]]s: * [[Pope Clement XI]]<ref name="clementeXI">Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 15. Saluation quoted by Baschera: "To Clement XI {{!}} Vicar on Earth of Our Lord”.</ref> * [[Victor Amadeus II of Sardinia|Victor Amadeus II of Savoy]]<ref name="amedeoII">Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 13. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To Victor Amadeus II of Savoy {{!}} future king”.</ref> * [[Charles XII of Sweden]]<ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 29. Saluation quoted by Baschera: : “To Charles XII {{!}} King of Sweden”|p. 29|baschera</ref> * [[Peter I of Russia]]<ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 33. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To Peter I {{!}} Caesar of Holy Russia”.</ref> * [[Frederick I of Prussia]]<ref name="federicoI">Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 39. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To you, Frederick I {{!}} Great King of Prussia”.</ref> * [[Philip V of Spain]]<ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 43. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To you, Philip {{!}} King of Spain”.</ref> * [[Anne, Queen of Great Britain|Anne of England]]<ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 49. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “For Anna {{!}} Queen of England and of Scotland”.</ref> * [[Louis XIV of France]]<ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 55. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To Louis XIV {{!}} Lord of France”.</ref> * Letters to the [[Cardinal (Catholicism)|Cardinals]]: * [[Rinaldo d'Este (1655-1737)|Rinaldo d’Este]]<ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 63. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To Rinaldo d'Este {{!}} Cardinal of the Holy Roman Church”.</ref> * [[Francesco Maria de' Medici, Duke of Rovere and Montefeltro|Francesco Maria de’ Medici]]<ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 67. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To Francesco Maria de' Medici {{!}} Cardinal of the Holy Roman Church”.</ref> * Letters to other Religious of the [[Catholic Church]]: * A certain abbot Argoth<ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 75. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “Very Reverend {{!}} Abbott Argoth”</ref><ref name="argoth107">Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 107. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To the Very Reverend {{!}} Abbott Argoth”</ref><ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 119. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To the Very Reverend {{!}} Abbott Argoth”.</ref><ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 149. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To the Very Reverend {{!}} Father Argoth”.</ref><ref name="argoth195">Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 195. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To the Very Reverend {{!}} Abbott Argoth”.</ref> * The sister (or ''consorella'') Marta<ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 83. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To my beloved {{!}} Sister Marta”.</ref><ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 95. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To my beloved {{!}} Sister Marta”.</ref><ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 137. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To my beloved {{!}} Sister Marta”.</ref><ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 143. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To my beloved {{!}} Sister Marta”.</ref><ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 155. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To my dear {{!}} Sister Marta”.</ref><ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 167. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To my dear {{!}} Sister Marta”.</ref><ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 189. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To my sweet {{!}} Sister Marta”.</ref> * A certain abbot Koldan<ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 89. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To the Very Reverend {{!}} Abbot Koldan”.</ref><ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 131. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To the Very Reverend {{!}} Abbot Koldan”.</ref><ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 179. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To the Very Reverend {{!}} Abbot Koldan”.</ref><ref name="koldan183">{Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 183. Saluation quoted by Baschera:: “To the Very Reverend {{!}} Abbot Koldan”.</ref> * A theologian Bruks<ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 101. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To the Very Reverend {{!}} Theologian Bruks”.</ref><ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 113. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To the Very Reverend {{!}} Theologian Bruks”.</ref><ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 125. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To the Very Reverend {{!}} Theologian Bruks”.</ref><ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 161. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To the Very Reverend {{!}} Theologian Bruks”.</ref><ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', p. 173. Saluation quoted by Baschera: “To the Very Reverend {{!}} Theologian Bruks”.</ref> * In letters to the historical figures several major events are predicted to happen to them and later their descendants or their country. In letters to the others, religious events are predicted general concern that some historical developments, some disasters and some technical progress. Letters of the Nun of Dresden prophesy events through a period of time from the end of the 17th century to the end of the 30th century.
===Conclusion=== The paper ends with a brief analysis of a particular aspect: the characters speak in a voice that suggests to the nun almost all of what to write.<ref name="pag8" /> At first, the authority of the nun is posted with this entry, as is the case for most of the clairvoyants; subsequently, unlike the others that kept the detachment from all their visions, the woman accepted more and more the presence of what became the “sweet voice” letters, even when it promised catastrophe.<ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', pp. 201-203</ref>
==Prophecies==
===Prophecies for the Popes of the Catholic Church=== According to the author, like the [[Prophecy of the Popes|Prophecies of St. Malachy]], the Nun of Dresden even gives a motto for the Popes, but only for the last eleven of them:<ref name="clementeXI" />
{| class="wikitable" |- !Motto of the Nun !! Who is supposed to be !! <small>Motto of [[Saint Malachy|St. Malachy]]</small> |- |White horse, with the sign of the Lion || [[Pope Leo XIII|Leo XIII]] <small>(Gioacchino Pecci, 1878–1903)</small> || <small>''Lumen de coelo''</small> |- |Black horse, with the sign of Mercy || [[Pope Pius X|Pius X]] <small>(Giuseppe Sarto, 1903–14)</small>|| <small>''Ignis Ardens''</small> |- |Yellow horse, with the sign of the Blessing || [[Pope Benedict XV|Benedict XV]] <small>(Giacomo Della Chiesa, 1914–22)</small>|| <small>''Religio depopulata''</small> |- |Red horse, with the sign of Mercy || [[Pope Pius XI|Pius XI]] <small>(Achille Ratti, 1922–39)</small>|| <small>''Fidens intrepida''</small> |- |Yellow horse, with the sign of Mercy || [[Pope Pius XII|Pius XII]] <small>(Eugenio Pacelli, 1939–58)</small>|| <small>''Pastor angelicus''</small> |- |Red horse, with the sign of the Precursor || [[Pope John XXIII|John XXIII]] <small>(Angelo Roncalli, 1958–63)</small>|| <small>''Pastor et nauta''</small> |- |Black horse, with the sign of Benjamin || [[Pope Paul VI|Paul VI]] <small>(Giovanbattista Montini, 1963–78)</small>|| <small>''Flos florum''</small> |- |White horse, with the sign of Mercy || [[Pope John Paul I|John Paul I]] <small>(Albino Luciani, 1978)</small>|| <small>''De medietate Lunae''</small> |- |Angelic Master of Jehoshaphat, with the sign of the Twelve || [[Pope John Paul II|John Paul II]] <small>(Karol Wojtyla, 1978–2005)</small>|| <small>''De Labore solis''</small> |- |Angelic Guide of Jehoshaphat, with the sign of Glory || [[Pope Benedict XVI|Benedict XVI]] <small>(Joseph Ratzinger, 2005–13)</small>|| <small>''De gloria olivae''</small> |- |Angel of Mercy, with the sign of Martyrdom || [[Pope Francis|Francis]] <small>(Jorge Bergoglio, 2013–present)</small>|| <small>''Petrus Romanus''</small> |}
The author points out that the name chosen by each of the several popes is connected to the sign prophesied by the motto. The author also notes a link between the color of the horses, according to the [[Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse]], and the historical period in which the pope lived:
* white horses correspond to the victory of the spiritual power of the Church; * black horses correspond to a period of justice and balance; * yellow horses correspond to death * red horses correspond to the rider who takes away peace and represents a period of preparation for war.<ref>Baschera, ''op cit.'', pp. 15-22.</ref>
In a letter to Frederick I of [[Prussia]], the nun predicts that “the last Peter will come from your land”.<ref name="federicoI" /> Prussia is the name of a historical region that now lies between the borders of [[Lithuania]], [[Russia]] and [[Poland]] with parts of eastern [[Germany]].
===Prophecies for the House of Savoy=== In her letter to Victor Amadeus II of Savoy, the visionary German made several prophecies about the [[House of Savoy]]. The letter is divided into three parts. In the first part, the nun warns the Duke about his conduct and is more a moral poem than a prophecy. The second part contains the prophecies about the Duke himself: already at the beginning, the nun turns to Victor Amadeus II, calling him the "future king", as he would very soon become the “king of an island” (that did really happen in 1713, in [[Sicily]]), then the king of another island (that happened in 1720, in [[Sardinia]]), and the “king of the mountains” (which, however, did not happen).<ref name="amedeoIIb">Baschera, ''op cit.'', pp. 24-27</ref>
In the third part of the letter, the prophecies of the House of Savoy are contained. Savoy's reign is likened to a parade of horse-drawn carriages. There are actually two. In the first of them, each carriage was pulled by eight smaller horses (i.e., the [[Kingdom of Sardinia]]) and, in the second, each carriage had five larger horses (i.e., the [[Kingdom of Italy]]). So far, the total of the rulers of the House of Savoy is eleven. Eight of them were the Kings of Sardinia, from Victor Amadeus II to [[Victor Emmanuel II of Italy|Victor Emmanuel II]], and the other four were the Kings of Italy, from Victor Emmanuel II to [[Umberto II of Italy|Umberto II]]. According to the author, the total would be eleven, if one counts twice Victor Emmanuel II, who was both the King of Sardinia and the King of Italy. The nun predicts that, between the fourth and fifth “big horse-drawn carriage” (i.e., between the fourth and fifth Kings of Italy), there would be a pause, during which the carriage was driven by “black horses”, which the author interprets as a republican or oligarchic government. According to the interpretation of this prophecy by Baschera, Italy would now be in this moment of pause so, in the future, there could be a fifth King of Italy, the twelfth and last king of the House of Savoy. He would be represented by a horse with a white cross and reign for a short time.<ref name="amedeoIIb" />
The nun gives an indication of the duration of both the Kingdom of Sardinia and the Kingdom of Italy, before the Republican break: the first would have a duration of “twelve times twelve years” (144, three years more than the actual total of 141 years), while the second would have a duration of "the year upside down" for the first king of Italy (who died at the age of almost 58 years, after the reign of little more than 85 years). The nun also includes, for the five Kings of Italy from the House of Savoy, how they would die:
{| class="wikitable" |- ! The Nun's prophesy !! Whom was meant!! Actual cause of death |- | <center>die of the plague</center> || <center>[[Victor Emmanuel II of Italy|Victor Emmanuel II]]</center> || <center>fever caused by a lung infection</center> |- | <center>die in the fire</center> || <center>[[Umberto I of Italy|Umberto I]]</center> || <center>killed by a gunshot</center> |- | <center>die from grief</center> || <center>[[Victor Emmanuel III of Italy|Victor Emmanuel III]]</center> || <center>in exile, a natural death</center> |- | <center>die from grief</center> || <center>[[Umberto II of Italy|Umberto II]]</center> || <center>in exile, a natural death</center> |- | <center>die from grief</center> || <center>?</center> || <center>?</center> |} She, as interpreted by the author, also prophesied that the fifth and last king of the House of Savoy of Italy would die in exile, a natural death.<ref name="amedeoIIb" />

Padua: MEB, 1986. {{ISBN|88-7669-138-3}}

La storia del mondo dal 1990 al 2090 secondo Nostradamus, la monaca di Dresda, don Bosco e Rasputin'' [The Big Book of Prophecies. The History of the World from 1990 to 2090 according to [[Nostradamus]], the Nun of Dresden, [[John Bosco|Don Bosco]] and [[Rasputin]]], MEB, 1994. {{ISBN|88-766-9438-2}}

The '''Three Princes''' was a name given to Princes [[Boun Oum]], [[Souvanna Phouma]] and [[Souphanouvong]] who represented respectively the royalist, neutralist and leftist factions in the [[Kingdom of Laos]] in the post-[[World War II|WWII]] period.<ref name="TIME">{{cite web|title=Laos: The Three Princes|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,827070,00.html|date=December 15, 1961|accessdate=2011-10-16|publisher=TIME Magazine}}</ref> The trio were named by King [[Savang Vatthana]] to form a coalition government following the independence of [[Kingdom of Laos|Laos]].<ref name="TIME"/>
==Background and Representatives== The Three Princes represented three different political views held during the [[Laotian Civil War]].
===Prince Boun Oum Na Champasak=== Right-wing Prince Boun Oum, cousin to the other two princes, overthrew the Phouma Government in 1960. Supported by [[Phoui Sananikone]], General [[Phoumi Nosavan]] and the Hmong Leader, General [[Vang Pao]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.vietnam.ttu.edu/airamerica/best/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-03-17 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130719082255/http://www.vietnam.ttu.edu/airamerica/best/ |archivedate=2013-07-19 |df= }}</ref>
===Prince Souvanna Phouma=== Pro-western Prince Souvanna Phouma was supported by [[Kong Le]] and the [[Royal Lao Government]]. [[File:Souvanna Phouma.jpg|thumb|150px|right|Prince Souvanna Phouma]]
===Prince Souphanouvong=== Half brother of Souvanna Phouma, Prince Souphanouvong, a staunch communist and the leader of the [[Pathet Lao]], was supported by [[Kaysone Phomvihane]] (later Prime Minister and President of the [[LPDR]]) and the North Vietnamese. By 1972, the Pathet Lao found it unacceptable to form a coalition with rightist members, mostly military generals and the rich and powerful [[Na Champassak]] and [[Sananikone]] families.<ref>https://docs.google.com/viewer?a=v&q=cache:PBDlk_WDN1oJ:jfk.hood.edu/Collection/White%2520Materials/Peace%2520Negotiations-POWs/POWs%25201424.pdf+powerful+sananikone+family&hl=en&pid=bl&srcid=ADGEEShp6c16cDh1duCjN9X3zzWui_XIrJBlR1Yu7uJU-YC3MMGw6z1cjsKo9Pvjata-78U3LV_Ei6E02djxm0Uq4Unsep9lrMRENnB2RSDnKLWA2waEo6DFCQPxzHPT5RK3po7qdJiI&sig=AHIEtbQkKngE1M-yTn5smwL4Ccr0faDAnQ</ref>

'''Yazid Mansouri''' ({{lang-ar|يزيد منصوري}}, Yazīd Manṣūrī) (born 25 February 1978 in [[Revin]], Ardennes, France) is a retired [[Algeria]]n [[Association football|footballer]] who played as a defensive midfielder.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lfp.fr/joueur/index.asp?no_joueur=11362 |title=Ligue de Football Professionnel – Ligue 1, Ligue 2, Coupe de la Ligue, Trophée des Champions |publisher=LFP.fr |date= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080915072249/http://www.lfp.fr/joueur/index.asp?no_joueur=11362 |archivedate=15 September 2008 |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dzfoot.com/joueur.php?joueur_id=489&saison_id=14 |title=La Fiche de Yazid MANSOURI – Football algérien |publisher=Dzfoot.com |date= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080914213959/http://www.dzfoot.com/joueur.php?joueur_id=489&saison_id=14 |archivedate=14 September 2008 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Mansouri announced his retirement from international football on 26 June 2010, after mentioning to the media that he will not be participating in the friendly in August against Gabon and the [[2012 African Cup of Nations qualification|2012 African Cup of Nations qualifiers]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lebuteur.com/en/actualites/mansouri-depuis-hier-au-qatar-lhistoire-se-rappellera-de-nous |title=Mansouri depuis hier au Qatar : «L’histoire se rappellera de nous |publisher=. Le Buteur |date=26 June 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100628042400/http://www.lebuteur.com/en/actualites/mansouri-depuis-hier-au-qatar-lhistoire-se-rappellera-de-nous |archivedate=28 June 2010 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
==Club career== Mansouri began his career at ''Tinqueux SC'', a small team from [[Tinqueux]] who were playing in the sixth division. At age 17, he left the club and signed with [[Le Havre AC]] who were playing in [[Ligue 1]], where he spent his first two seasons playing in the reserve side. He made his debut in the first game of the 1997–1998 season, coming as a second-half substitute against [[Olympique de Marseille]]. He would slowly assert himself at the club and would eventually go on to make 134 appearances and scoring 2 goals in 6 seasons in both [[Ligue 1]] and [[Ligue 2]].
At the start of the 2003–2004 season, Mansouri was loaned out for the season to English [[Championship]] side [[Coventry City F.C.]].<ref>[http://www.sportinglife.com/football/nationwide1/coventry/news/story_get.cgi?STORY_NAME=soccer/03/08/20/manual_170140.html&TEAMHD=coventry ] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110629213102/http://www.sportinglife.com/football/nationwide1/coventry/news/story_get.cgi?STORY_NAME=soccer%2F03%2F08%2F20%2Fmanual_170140.html&TEAMHD=coventry |date=29 June 2011 }}</ref> Mansouri made 14 appearances in the first half of the season before leaving, against the clubs wishes, to play for [[Algeria national football team|Algeria]] at the [[2004 African Cup of Nations]] in Mali. His contract was subsequently terminated and he remained without a club for the rest of the season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.coventrycity-mad.co.uk/news/loadnews.asp?cid=TMNW&id=137182 |title=Mansouri Contract Terminated – Coventry City FC – Coventry MAD |publisher=Coventrycity-mad.co.uk |date= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040310203353/http://www.coventrycity-mad.co.uk/news/loadnews.asp?cid=TMNW&id=137182 |archivedate=10 March 2004 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
In the summer of 2004, Mansouri signed with [[Ligue 2]] side [[LB Châteauroux]] where he easily imposed himself in the middle of the park. He would go on to make 63 appearances for the club, starting every one of them, and scoring 2 goals. He was also the captain of the team in the 2005–2006 season.
At the beginning of the 2006 season, Mansouri signed a two-year contract with [[Ligue 1]] side [[FC Lorient]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dzfoot.com/news.php?hot_id=1777 |title=Transferts : Mansouri au FC Lorient |publisher=Dzfoot.Com |date=25 February 1978 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120402015021/http://www.dzfoot.com/news.php?hot_id=1777 |archivedate=2 April 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
On 23 June 2010, Mansouri signed a Two-year contract with [[Qatar]]i-side [[Al-Sailiya Sport Club|Al-Sailiya]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dzfoot.com/news.php?hot_id=6829 |title=Transferts : Yazid Mansouri à Al Sailiya |publisher=Dzfoot.com |date=23 June 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120911132319/http://www.dzfoot.com/news.php?hot_id=6829 |archivedate=11 September 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>[http://www.al-sharq.com/articles/more.php?id=200178 ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110707102908/http://www.al-sharq.com/articles/more.php?id=200178 |date=7 July 2011 }}</ref> On 22 December 2011, Mansouri signed a contract until the end of the season with [[Algeria]]i-side [[CS Constantine]].<ref>[http://www.competition.dz/Actualite/-Yazid-Mansouri-signe-au-CSC ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120309165638/http://www.competition.dz/Actualite/-Yazid-Mansouri-signe-au-CSC |date=9 March 2012 }}</ref>
==International career== Mansouri first featured for the [[Algeria national football team|Algerian national team]] in a set of friendlies against [[FC Zurich]] and [[ES Troyes AC|ES Troyes]] in 1999. He received his first official call-up to the national team on 6 November 2001 in a friendly game against [[France national football team|France]] in Paris. He was a member of the [[Algeria national football team|Algerian team]] at the [[2002 African Cup of Nations]], [[2004 African Cup of Nations]] and [[2010 African Cup of Nations]], where Algeria finished fourth.
Mansouri was a member of the [[Algeria national football team|Algerian team]] at the [[2010 FIFA World Cup|2010 World Cup]]. However, he lost the captaincy and a spot in the starting line-up prior to the first group game against [[Slovenia national football team|Slovenia]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Associated Press |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/jun/10/world-cup-2010-algeria-yazid-mansouri |title=World Cup 2010: Algeria to drop captain Yazid Mansouri | Football | guardian.co.uk |publisher=Guardian |date=10 June 2010}}</ref> He did not participate in any of Algeria's games at the World Cup.
Shortly after the [[2010 FIFA World Cup|2010 World Cup]], Mansouri announced his international retirement.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lebuteur.com/en/actualites/mansouri-depuis-hier-au-qatar-lhistoire-se-rappellera-de-nous |title=Mansouri depuis hier au Qatar : "L’histoire se rappellera de nous" |publisher=Lebuteur.com |date=26 June 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100628042400/http://www.lebuteur.com/en/actualites/mansouri-depuis-hier-au-qatar-lhistoire-se-rappellera-de-nous |archivedate=28 June 2010 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> With 67 appearances for the national team, Mansouri is the 9th most capped player in Algeria's history.
